The Hotel Indigo Birmingham is located in a landmark Art Deco-style building dating from the early 1930s in the city's historic Five Points South neighborhood. Originally designed for medical offices and across from the first apothecary in Birmingham, the building became a hotel in the 1980s, but still retains its original medical insignia etched above the elevator doors. The hotel's design acknowledges the building's rich history, while incorporating modern amenities, like hardwood floors, spa-inspired showers, luxury bath amenities and linens.  We're also adding some exciting (and tasty) options to an area already known as one of the city's premier dining and entertainment districts. The Rx Lounge pays homage to the medical apothecary theme and provides prescriptions in the form of food and beverage curated by acclaimed Chef Niko Romero.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: An earthquake in 1964 leveled much of downtown Anchorage, and many in town were hesitant to rebuild. Walter J. Hickel was more optimistic. The Kansas native--who had arrived in Alaska in 1940 at the age of 20, with only 37 cents to his name--had already been investing in Alaska's future for decades, building hotels and business centers as well as serving as Alaska's governor, all with an eye to making Alaska the American gateway to the Pacific Rim. The Hotel has prospered and expanded with the times: the first Tower opened in 1965, followed by Tower II in 1972 and Tower III in 1978. Today, the 547-room hotel plays host to dignitaries, celebrities and people from all walks who love the grandeur of Alaska.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Born in Melbourne, Andrew Chippindall began and developed his career in hospitality in various properties throughout Australia. His tenure in London with TrustHouse Forte led him to a ski resort in Austria, where he spent six years refining his management skills. Next, Andrew worked as Director of Rooms in Bintan Lagoon, Indonesia. This depth in hospitality experience brought him back to Australia, where he served on the Sydney Organizing Committee for the 2000 Olympic Games. Because he felt his life needed to become more exciting, he met his wife and moved to America. He first worked with Westroc at Sanctuary on Camelback Mountain, and now manages the Hotel Valley Ho in Scottsdale. A devoted snowboarder and fan of all things in the winter, Andrew is eagerly awaiting Scottsdale's first snowfall of the season.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Hotel Valley Ho first opened in 1956. It combined modern and Southwestern styles, becoming an instant icon in Downtown Scottsdale. Owner-managers Robert and Evelyn Foehl brought many celebrity guests to the hotel, who had previously stayed at their resort in Southern California. Robert Wagner and Natalie Wood even had their 1957 wedding reception in the hotel ballroom.

The hotel went up for sale in 2002 and was purchased by local company MSR Properties. Westroc, another local company, executed a strong vision to restore the hotel to its former mid-century splendor. The hotel reopened in 2005; additions included ZuZu, the OH Pool, and VH Spa. 

Alan Hess, architect and author, has called Hotel Valley Ho "one of the best-preserved mid-century hotels in the country". Relax in the ZuZu Lounge while sipping on a martini to classic fifties tunes, and you'll forget this mid-century gem exists in the present.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Hotel Valley Ho was cool back in 1956 when it first opened its doors, before Downtown Scottsdale was downtown. It's every bit as chic now, after an expansive but meticulously groomed 2005 renovation. This mid-century modern landmark offers posh, playful rooms and suites, ZuZu perfect for curious foodies, and VH Spa for Vitality + Health. Hotel Valley Ho is centrally located in Downtown Scottsdale, just a short walk from shops, restaurants, and Old Town's renowned art galleries. The seven-story Tower is the artful elite hotel within a hotel. It offers spacious one and two-bedroom Tower Suites with complete kitchens as well as generously sized Tower Signature Guest Rooms. Here, the rooms are distinctly designed as light, bright, and fanciful havens with sweeping panoramic views. Hotel Valley Ho. The evolution of cool.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Since buying the Evergreen in 2002, we've worked to transform it into the kind of special resort that is deserving of its amazing location.

The Evergreen Lodge is a founding B-corporation, a new type of company that uses the power of business to solve social and environmental problems.  Aside from our focus on operating an amazing resort, we also run and fully self-fund our own behind-the-scenes youth employment program.

We hope you can come stay with us.  Lee, Brian & Dan
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
The Evergreen Lodge is a historic Yosemite destination originally built to serve the workers building the O'Shaughnessy Dam in Hetch Hetchy Valley.  In the early years, the Evergreen was a post office, restaurant and general store.  Lore has it that moonshine was brewed in the basement and a brothel was run out of two of the cabins.  In the late 1930's, local workers frequented the Evergreen tavern and took advantage of three illegal slot machines located on site.  During this time, a Standard Oil gas station was built in front of the lodge. The pumps are long since gone, but the original gas station still stands today. 

The lodge has been newly expanded and renovated, and it now blends the modern comforts of a resort, the relaxed approach and activities of a dude ranch and the timeless warmth of a historic 1920's lodge.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Frommer's describes the Evergreen Lodge as "the classic Yosemite experience," Sunset Magazine calls it a "Hidden Gem," and San Francisco Magazine lists it as one of the "Top 10 getaways everyone will be talking about-- in 5 years." 

The newly expanded lodge is a special place where you can enjoy a beautiful cabin in the woods, great food and drink, a host of activities, guided recreation and the serenity of the stunning, uncrowded Hetch Hetchy area. The Evergreen is a year-round resort that provides the perfect mix of recreation, relaxation and indulgence.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Convict Lake Resort, a year round gateway to the Eastern Sierra, is a unique family - human and fury - friendly destination nestled in the aspen trees of Convict Canyon, below the towering peaks of Mt. Morrison and Mt. Laurel and adjacent to a 170 acre crystal clear lake.  
The resort is located 10 minutes south of the town of Mammoth Lakes, CA & across from the Mammoth/Yosemite airport off Highway 395. The resort offers cozy mountain cabins, luxury houses, dining, horseback rides, and pontoon boat rentals. Convict Lake is a popular destination for fishing and hiking.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: Hotel Château du Sureau began with a dream. The vision and worldly experience of Erna Kubin-Clanin became a beacon of tranquility and luxury in 1984. A native of Vienna, Austria, Erna has translated Old World Europe's high standard of service and fine dining to a world of beauty and calm that is Château du Sureau - the "Castle by the Elderberries". Erna's half-century of experience hosting and delighting guests has created an epic fairy tale destination waiting for you to enjoy and carried on by Dr. Bernard Rosenson & Family.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Château du Sureau is a graceful blend of old-world charm with all of today's conveniences. Each guest suite is appointed with fine furnishings and modern amenities to maximize tranquility and comfort. Whether you plan to enjoy a private picnic in Yosemite or a glass of Bordeaux in the library, activities are plentiful with many opportunities to renew and relax.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: While Rush Creek Lodge is the first new lodge built in the Yosemite area in over 25 years, our ties to Yosemite reach back to 2002, when we purchased the nearby Evergreen Lodge as a means to self-fund a Youth Program teaching job and life skills to under-served Bay Area youth. We are thrilled to be able to expand our Youth Program, environmental mission, and meaningful approach to hospitality here at Rush Creek Lodge.

With nine cozy rooms, some which feature bunk beds perfect for children, we are the best basecamp for your adventures near three of the most beautiful National Parks in the country.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Your Innkeeper, Sherilee N., pronounced Sherry - lee, manages all the aspects of the Bed and Breakfast. With her love of the mountains, outdoors, Yosemite, and National Parks, Sherilee has found her calling here at Yosemite's Nature's Inn. Breakfast has always been Sherilee's favorite meal of the day, and she hopes you notice when you dine at the Inn. She takes to the time to make most of the food from scratch, with local ingredients and produce.
Having grown up in Fresno, CA just 1.5 hours from Yosemite, Sherilee has spent countless days in the park, showing family and friends around, taking a tour, camping, and hiking many miles in and around Yosemite every year. She can assist you in making personalized itineraries including driving tours, hikes, and general exploration in and around the Yosemite and Sequoia National Parks. Short on time, or have a few extra days? The innkeeper can help you plan an itinerary for your specific visit.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: Nature's Inn B&B started in 1987 as the Silver Spur Trail B&B. A handcrafted log wood lodge built by the Hayes brothers. They operated with 2 rooms for rent and played up the western theme for their guests with a cowboy decor. The second owners bought the bed and breakfast and changed the name to Nature's Inn B&B, add on a third room to rent as well as a hot tub spa and swimming pool. They also changed the theme of the Inn from cowboys to nature, adding more floral accents and humming birds. In 2012 Sherilee Nimon and her parents purchased the Inn. The theme of nature was then refined to focus on Yosemite and all of it's natural beauty. The Inn was also opened up to its full potential, making the lodge a cozy place for guests to hang out, expanding the backyard to include a bocce ball court, horse shoe pit, outdoor courtyard with gas fireplace which is great for relaxing and star gazing. She also began serving a full, hot and hearty breakfast every morning to guests.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Yosemite's Nature's Inn Bed and Breakfast is a handcrafted log wood lodge located 30 minutes from the south entrance of Yosemite National Park. Come see the splendor of Yosemite and stay in style. Start your day with a hot and hearty breakfast and end your day in the comfort of our hot tub or swim a few laps in the pool.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
In the early 1920's, Stephen Mather, the National Park Service Director, realized that the Park needed accommodations to suit the affluent and influential traveler. The concept of a hotel such as The Ahwahnee® became the impetus to draw such a visitor.

The site for The Ahwahnee, once a village of the native Miwoks, was chosen because of its exposure to the sun and stunning views of Yosemite's icons - Half Dome, Yosemite Falls and Glacier Point.

In July 1925, Gilbert Stanley Underwood was selected as the architect for Yosemite's new luxury hotel. Due to its remote location, the construction of The Ahwahnee was the most complex trucking endeavor of its day. Over 5,000 tons of stone, 1,000 tons of steel, and 30,000 feet of timber were hauled over the challenging mountain roads. To protect The Ahwahnee from fire, a fate of many of the Park's earlier hotels, its wood-like facade is actually concrete, poured into rough-hewn wooden forms and stained to look like redwood.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: The Ahwahnee Hotel shines as Yosemite National Park's distinctive upscale hotel. Serving Yosemite National Park visitors and guests since the 1920's, The Ahwahnee is an architectural gem - combining grandness and intimacy. With breathtaking views of such iconic park scenery as Yosemite Falls, Half Dome and Glacier Point, the hotel brings the outdoors in, inviting guests to feel right at home surrounded by unsurpassed natural beauty.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
The Narrow Gauge Inn was built in the 1950's as the 
Swiss Melody Inn by Swiss immigrants Rudy and Luce Stauffer. They also restored the Yosemite Mountain Sugar Pine Railroad, which is located just next door to the Inn and to this day is operated by Max Stauffer, Rudy and Luce son. The Inn has gone through several changes of ownership over the years. Aung Oo became the proud owner of The Narrow Gauge Inn in 2011 and is taking the Inn and Restaurant to places we have never been in the past.  Come stay and dine and become part of the family.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Adding further appeal, Hotel Teatro's ("teatro" means "theatre" in Italian) decor takes it's cue from the neighboring Denver Theatre Company, which has endowed the hotel with an outstanding collection of black-and-white and sephia tone photographs, as well as costumes, props and set pieces from 20 seasons of productions.
Originally the site of the historic Tramway Tower, Hotel Teatro opened in 1999 after an 18-month reincarnation.  The original red glazed brick and white terracotta facade and the coffered plaster ceiling were restored; the large double hung wood frame windows were restored; and a serback, ninth floor was added with a rooftop deck guarded by the parapet of the old terracotta cornice.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Hotel Teatro offers an ideal location in the heart of Downtown Denver. attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Swapping addresses comes naturally to Thierry Kennel, General Manager of Four Seasons Hotel Denver. Born in France, he had already followed his father, a shoe company executive, around a good slice of the world by the time he'd reached adolescence.

Kennel studied hotel management in Switzerland, then headed off to Houston, Texas, as an overnight supervisor in stewarding. Kennel believes that the hotel experiences of his youth have given him singular insight into what is required of a luxury hotel. "Guest expectations are something I can appreciate," he says, noting that one of his favorite parts of the industry is constantly finding new, unexpected ways to delight guests. "No matter what guests require - specialty pillows, rare Scotch - we're going to get it for them, night or day."

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Every year, hundreds of thousands of craft beer fans from around the world make a pilgrimage to Dogfish Head's coastal Delaware brewpub and brewery. For nearly a decade, we've helped host some of these folks at the Dogfish Head Brewmaster's Suite at a lovely Lewes inn. The new Dogfish Inn gives us a bigger home base dedicated to exploring all of the off-centered opportunities in this beautiful part of the state.

"We've already got great excitement from the Department of Tourism, Delaware Economic Development Office and the Governor's Office for this project," says Dogfish Founder and President Sam Calagione. "And we're excited to work with the local agencies as well because we're very confident that this motel will bring a lot more business not just to Dogfish but to the other local retailers and restaurateurs in Delaware."

Dogfish is more than just a brewery, and the Dogfish Inn is more than just an inn. For starters, it's in just the right spot: overlooking the harbor in historic L
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: The Dogfish Inn embraces modern style and convenience while celebrating a bygone era of family vacations, big cars and endless summers. attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
I was born and raised in Zurich, Switzerland. It was always my dream to own a B&B. My husband Michael likes to say that the Swiss are born with a hospitality gene. That's pushing it a tad but I do like being an innkeeper very much. Before moving to the US in 1987, the closest I came to working in the hospitality business was as a flight attendant for Swissair during the heydays of the airline industry. 
French and German were my first languages.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
My husband Michael and I purchased a 1860 National Register plantation house outside of Chestertown, Maryland as a private residence in the summer of 1987.  It took 6 months and lots of elbow grease to open the doors of the Brampton Bed & Breakfast inn with 2 guestrooms. 21 years later our inn offers 6 rooms, 2 suites and 5 cottages. 
We are very lucky to have the best staff in the world to help us pamper our guests. Many of our faithful guests have been coming for more than 20 years. Amazing!
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Consider the award-winning Brampton, a romantic bed and breakfast inn, for a relaxing visit to the Eastern Shore of Maryland. This quiet oasis of 20 acres, less than a mile outside the historic town of Chestertown, Maryland, is ideally suited for those seeking a luxurious and private escape. The upper Chesapeake region is the perfect place to explore on bikes or
kayaks for a more active experience.

The Brampton's spacious guest rooms and cottages, with glorious views, wood-burning fireplaces and spa tubs provide the perfect setting for a romantic Chesapeake getaway. The daily changing and freshly prepared a-la-carte breakfast is  served in Brampton's elegant dining room, front porch (weather permitting) or delivered to the privacy of the cottage rooms.

Our park-like setting offers a serene place for strolls or a game of crocket.

The inn is ideally locate to explore nearby towns such as Easton, St. Michaels and Annapolis.

Newly Renovated Ocean Glass Retreat! 

Indulge in comfort and relaxation at our upgraded rooms, nestled within minutes of the sun-drenched beach. Whether you're looking for a quick getaway or an extended summer vacation, our accommodations offer the perfect mix of convenience, luxury, and value.
What makes us unique:
Renovated Rooms: Discover coastal elegance and comfort in our newly revamped spaces. From coastal decor to top-notch amenities, we've crafted every detail with your utmost comfort in mind.
Summer Escape: Don't miss the chance to create lasting memories by the ocean.

Steps from the Beach: Embrace the coastal charm with access to the beach, only a few blocks away. Step outside, reserve our carts/towels and beach chairs, and immerse yourself in sunbathing, swimming, beach combing, and more along the sandy shores.
Your comfort and satisfaction are our top priorities. Our welcoming staff is dedicated to ensuring your stay is relaxing and memorable. Whether you seek local tips, assistance with reservations, or anything else, we're here to make your experience exceptional.
Book your summer escape now and embark on a coastal adventure like no other! Paradise beckons at our newly renovated coastal retreat. Reserve your spot today!

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Welcome to historic Easton, Maryland and to the Best Western Plus Easton Inn & Suites. Comfortably designed and furnished, you are sure to be able to unwind and relax throughout your entire stay, from the lobby to the indoor pool to your guest room. 

From the moment you walk in you are welcomed into a warm, inviting great room with our grand stairs leading up to the second floor. The decor throughout the property has been carefully selected from local artists, photographers and carvers to bring more of the historic town inside. Help yourself to our complimentary coffee, tea and juice 24 hours a day and enjoy a filling, Free hot breakfast every morning. 

Take a stroll into the downtown area, accompanied with a walking map of all the stores available at the front desk. Take in a bit of history, catch a show at the historic Avalon Theatre and get your fill of fresh seafood and local attractions. Local restaurants are all within one mile of the property, as well as right next door.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: At the Best Western Plus Easton Inn & Suites you're sure to find that little something extra. For the business traveler, a spacious work desk and free internet access are included in all our guest rooms to ensure you don't miss a beat while you're away from the office. We also have an in-house fitness room, so you can keep up your workout routine while you're on the road. As always, the Best Western Plus Easton Inn & Suites will provide you with the superior customer service that you are used to at Best Western® Hotels & Resorts.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: My husband and I opened Summer Nites in 2003.  Rick was a teacher  & wrestling coach in the Wildwood School District for 32 years, he was also a builder in his spare time.  When he retired in 2001 from teaching  he went into the building business full time. Sheila worked in Human Resource Management in the casino industry for 20 years.  With Rick's expertise and vision and Sheila's creativity Summer Nites was created.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: Our home was built in 1903 and we opened Summer Nites in 2003.  It's hard to believe it's been 10 years, where does the time go.  The coolest thing about operating a Bed & Breakfast is the wonderful people we have had the priviledge of meeting throughout the years.  So many return every year, that they feel like family.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: A stay at Summer Nites is like a step back into the 1950's. We're a 50's Theme Bed and Breakfast decorated in 1950's furnishings and décor. We are open all year and gift certificates are available. Guest can stay in one of our 8 rooms, from the Elvis Suite, 60's Suite, 70's  Disco Room, Life's a Beach Room, Marilyn Room, 50's TV Room, 50's Music Room or 50's Movie Room.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Icona Diamond Beach was formerly known as Pier 6600 Hotel.This hotel was known by many to be an iconic landmark of Diamond Beach, NJ. At Icona Diamond Beach we're proud of where we come from. Icona was born from the desire to introduce Diamond Beach to the world, & we're proud of our evolution.

We've done our best to capture the very essence of who we are & what we offer with one simple & elegant, yet powerful word...Icona. That word would become our name. Here's the story behind it: At the heart of our name is the word icon. For us an icon is the symbol of the sacred. Our guests come to Icona to experience sacred time with their family and loved ones. We strive to provide a level of service unmatched in coastal vacation resorts. Our goal is that your time with us truly becomes a sacred experience.

We invite you to come and stay with us at Icona Resorts Diamond Beach & experience the surf, sun, and sacred moments of relaxation with those you love.

name: Hyatt Regency Chesapeake Bay Golf Resort, Spa and Marina

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Michael and Wanda O'Brien both fell in love with the ocean at an early age. Michael, who grew up on Long Island, spent many childhood summers at the family beach house and later would frequently visit his former college roommate in Wildwood. Wanda, a New Hampshire native, fondly remembers her family's trips to the beach and the old wooden boardwalk near her grandmother's home in Brick, NJ.

So, it's not surprising that when the couple decided they wanted to take the plunge and buy a bed and breakfast, they kept coming back to the beach.
While Michael has an extensive business background, the bed and breakfast has allowed him to tap into his true passion for cooking. His enthusiasm for fresh ingredients and creative cuisine is evident in every dish he serves. Wanda runs the day to day operations and has been known to cook herself.  Her true passion is gardening and she plans to create some gardens over the coming years to compliment the cuisine.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: The Inn was originally the home of the Leaming Rice family built in 1905. He was the local civil engineer and picked the location because it is the highest point in North Wildwood.  The building was passed along to family members until 1985 when the second owners of the house renovated it for use as a Bed & Breakfast. They converted the main house into an eight room Bed & Breakfast.   In 1996, the Carriage House (it contained carriages used for providing guests rides on beautiful Central Avenue) was converted into two rooms.  Each has its own porch, fireplace, air conditioning/heat controls,  flat screen  Satellite TV with a DVD player, wet bar, double whirlpool tubs, and much more.   The current owners, Wanda and Michael O'Brien took over operations in July, 2014.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Your room charge includes most of the amenities you can think of:  WiFi, soft-drinks, coffee, tea, afternoon snack, full, 3-course sit-down breakfast with a choice of entrees each morning, outdoor hot-tub, beach chairs, towels for the beach, & DVDs. In the summer, watch fireworks from our veranda on Friday nights.  

The Candlelight Inn is a member of Select Registry.  SR has a rigorous inspection program where the inspector is "secret shopper" guest.   We are also a Bedandbreakfast.com Diamond Collection Inn.  

The inn was built as a private home in 1905 and has been beautiful maintained over the last 110 years.  Every room has a unique character.  Even with the old world charm, every room has a private bath; some with whirlpool tubs, fireplaces, queen or king size beds, and satellite TV with DVD players.  Each guest room has robes and slippers for your use during your stay.  

We are three blocks from the beach and boardwalk and have many great restaurants within walking distance.  Cape May is a fifteen minute drive away.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Long, long, ago, the building now known as Canalside Inn was constructed just feet from the sandy shoreline in Rehoboth Beach, DE.  In 1969, the building was lifted off the ground and moved to its current location at 34 Sixth St., Rehoboth Beach, DE 1971.

The Inn has known many names over the years – from the Moonwalk Hotel to the Sand in my Shoes before becoming known as the Canalside Inn in 2000. 

The Inn’s current owners, and owners of prominent leadership training academy BKD Leaders, found themselves drawn to Rehoboth, with memories of childhood summers. The couple’s combined 20 years of professional hospitality experience, coupled with extensive travel to more than 26 countries and 40 states, helped inspire a desire to create a one-of-a-kind guesthouse that seamlessly blends a carefree guest experience with a training, development, and strategic executive retreat environment.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Best of Delaware 2020
Voted Best Bed and Breakfast Inn by Delaware Today Magazine.

Canalside Inn feels like both a place to meet and celebrate with loved ones in chic accommodations, and a place to escape from the office to focus leadership teams on growing your business. Canalside Inn special offers and packages are designed to give the best possible value alongside luxurious treatments for people and pets.

Dr. Bryan and Kristen Deptula, the Inn's current owners and owners of prominent leadership training academy BKD Leaders, found themselves drawn to Rehoboth, where Dr. Bryan spent his childhood summers. The couple's combined 20 years of professional hospitality experience, coupled with extensive travel to more than 26 countries and 40 states, helped inspire a desire to create a one-of-a-kind guesthouse that seamlessly blends a carefree guest experience with a training, development, and strategic executive retreat environment.

Canalside Inn is committed to values-centered customer service, making a positive environmental impact...

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
In 1905, Asa Candler—the founder of Coca-Cola—hired two architects to design and construct a landmark building on Peachtree Street in downtown Atlanta. The work of those architects, George Stewart and George E. Murphy, will reopened in the summer of 2019 as The Candler Hotel, and its restoration represents a homecoming to Beaux Arts refinement in the very heart of the city. An outward-facing restaurant—named By George in honor of the duo that crafted its space—is the hotel’s destination dining room.

By George is open throughout the day, and it will offesr a pure, classic cuisine—largely influenced by Contemporary American cooking.   

Like the hotel’s high marble columns, tinkling chandeliers, and original period elevators, By George will serve as an iconic reminder of a metropolitan polish that exists outside of trends, one that is making its return to Atlanta’s oldest center.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: The Candler Hotel's restaurant, By George, is located on famed Peachtree Street and offers a Contemporary American menu and wine program for curious palettes-

Waldorf Astoria Atlanta Buckhead blends contemporary style with irresistible Southern charm. Soaring 42-stories, the property is located on Peachtree Road in the heart of Buckhead, the perfect base from which to explore the city, with easy access to top dining, shopping, and cultural attractions. Perfectly situated to enjoy Buckhead's vibrant cultural, dining and fashion scene, The Waldorf Astoria provides the perfect home away from home amongst the best of Atlanta.

The 127 spacious guest rooms and suites provide guests with city views, expansive marble bathrooms, and modern technology. Many have outdoor terraces. name: The Candler Hotel Atlanta, Curio Collection by Hilton

attributes.about_this_biz_history: The Candler Building was completed in just 2 years. Construction started in 1904 by Coca-Cola magnate Asa Griggs Candler. When the building was complete in 1906, it was documented as Atlanta's tallest building - its first steel skyscraper - and became the original home of Central Bank and Trust, the bank founded by Asa Griggs Candler. The Beaux-Arts details remain intact today and cornerstone reads 'Candler Investment Co. 1904 Geo. E. Murphy Architect'.  Surrounding the building and each of the 3 entrances is detailed stonework flanked by Corinthian columns that feature carved panels illustrating liberal arts and sciences. Statues of leisurely women can be seen posed above the East and West entrances.  The Candler family crest is also featured above each street entrance doorway and displayed prominently on the ornate lobby mailbox.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
The Candler Hotel Atlanta - Curio Collection by Hilton Atlanta. Situated downtown on famous Peachtree St Atlanta. Set within The Candler Building, Atlanta's first steel skyscraper and on the National Register of Historic Places, this boutique hotel honors its past by retaining its iconic lobby and Beaux-Arts architecture with other areas thoughtfully restored and reimagined by designer Nicole Hollis. Arguably Atlanta's favorite hotel.
Our chic hotel offers 265 brand new guest rooms with bright, modern décor and amenities which include Smart TV's, mini refrigerator and laptop sized safe. Make the most of business travel or family weekends by upgrading to a one-bedroom suite with separate lounge, sofa bed and soaking tub.
Hotel amenities include complimentary WiFi, a fitness center with Peloton bikes, business center and full-service restaurant By George, housed in the former Central Bank & Trust banking hall, helmed by renowned and award-winning chef Hugh Acheson. For groups and meeting's The Candler Hotel - Curio Collection by Hilton, Atlanta has 6,000 square feet of flexible meeting space suitable for all types of meetings and social events.

about_this_biz_business_recommendation.description: Waikiki Parc Hotel, Waikikii's hottest address, is Halekulani's sister hotel.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Love Hospitality
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
The story of Halekulani is in many ways the story of Waikiki itself. It begins just after the turn of the 20th century, with the construction of a small residential hotel called Hau Tree, consisting of a simple beachfront home and five tiny bungalows.

In 1917, Juliet and Clifford Kimball purchased the hotel and gradually expanded the operation, establishing it as a stylish resort for wealthy vacationers. They named it Halekulani, or "House Befitting Heaven."
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Halekulani has been hosting visitors to Waikiki Beach for nearly 100 years. Today its reputation for gracious hospitality, impeccable service and magnificent cuisine is unequaled on Oahu and renowned, throughout the world.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:

This lifestyle boutique hotel that offers a personalized service and a  stylish place to call home when visiting the islands. Warm and friendly service combined with a sophisticated coastal-casual design are the hallmarks of the property which provide you with a quiet and calm retreat just steps from the vibrancy of Waikiki.
Vive Hotel encourages guests to book direct and we will waive the nightly amenity fee in full! See you in Waikiki!
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Mr. Douglas Chang is the General Manager of The Ritz-Carlton Residences, Waikiki Beach. He is a seasoned leader with 35 years of luxury hospitality experience and directs a team of ladies and gentlemen to manage the new residential resort and deliver legendary Ritz-Carlton service to residence owners and their guests. Most recently, Mr. Chang served as General Manager of The Ritz-Carlton, St. Louis. Prior to this, he was General Manager of The Ritz-Carlton Club and Residences, Kapalua Bay, a luxury residential property that included whole ownership and fractional-ownership homes. His hospitality experience in the Hawaiian Islands also includes leadership positions at other luxury resort properties.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
When our 'Ewa Tower first opened its 307-residence on July 15, 2016, The Ritz-Carlton Residences, Waikiki Beach ushered in a new era of luxury travel, attracting jet setters from around the world. The resort debuted its Diamond Head Tower's 245-residences on October 15, 2018, marking the completion of Oahu's first Ritz-Carlton Residences. With 552 rooms and suites, the resort officially became the largest Ritz-Carlton Residences in the brand's global portfolio.

Guerin Glass Architects, inspired by Hawai'i's natural elements, designed both 38-story towers using a mauka (mountain) to makai (sea) vision that is seen in the resort's stunning exterior, through artful details and inspired craftsmanship. The exterior front reflects the ocean, sky, and wind and the exterior back reflects the mountains and Honolulu's urban metropolis. A three-dimensional, modern interpretation of traditional Hawaiian kapa (bark cloth) design covers the first three floors of each tower.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Discover Waikiki's most distinctive luxury resort with ocean views from every corner at The Ritz-Carlton Residences, Waikiki Beach. Oahu's first Ritz-Carlton property features 552 stylishly appointed, residential-style rooms and suites in two towers, all of which are ocean facing, providing you with an unparalleled view of the Pacific. With 246 suites, the resort boasts the largest number of hotel luxury suites on the island.

Guests can discover a vast array of distinctive experiences along with legendary Ritz-Carlton service. Amenities include two of the highest infinity pools in Waikiki with private cabanas, a premier fitness center, yoga room, and movie theatre. The Ritz-Carlton Spa offers customized treatments that highlight the balancing elements and traditional healing methods of the islands.

Adding to the enjoyment is a selection of fine dining experiences that are both creative in taste and presentation, ensuring an adventure for the senses. Experiences include a sushi legend from Japan, modern French cuisine, outdoor Italian concept, and a global high-end gourmet market.

With more than 6,000 square feet of indoor function space, meetings and events at The Ritz-Carlton Residences, Waikiki Beach leave attendees feeling productive, inspired, and better yet, with a story to tell.

The stunning Marriott Hotel Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa is located along the world famous Waikiki Beach and Pacific Ocean. Visit the Diamond Head Crater next to the resort, or nearby Pearl Harbor and Waikiki Aquarium. Enjoy our newly renovated lobby, locally inspired dining, an on-site spa and refreshing pool.

about_this_biz_business_recommendation.description: A modern experience where breakfast, lunch, and dinner are served fresh using locally-sourced ingredients and everybody knows your name.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Polly has worked at the Modern since it’s inception in June 2007. She works tirelessly to make sure our guests feel welcome and cared for, from booking to check-in and beyond.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
The Modern Hotel originated during the height of the Great Depression in Nampa, Idaho. Two sheepherders, Regina Echevarria, and her husband, had lost all of their sheep, so they went all-in and opened a Basque boarding house.

Time passed, and 60 years later, Regina's family bought the old Travelodge in Boise, did a complete renovation, and named it after the original Modern.

At today's Modern Hotel, a rich history radiates amidst Boise's unique, vibrant culture.The courteous and professional staff want to make your visit easy and low-stress.

City-centered, yet close to whitewater and mountains.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: A home-away-from-home - in Downtown Boise, Idaho - for all who value stylish design and ridiculously comfortable beds. The Modern Bar and Restaurant serves drinks and dinner everyday!

attributes.about_this_biz_history: The Baney Family, founders of the Oxford Hotel Group, have been in the hospitality business since 1955. Since then, the Oxford Hotel Group has expanded to 14 different cities throughout Idaho, Washington, Oregon, and California.

The Grove Hotel is Boise's premier downtown hotel.  Located in the heart of the city and attached to the CenturyLink Arena, just steps from Idaho's State Capitol, Boise Centre on the Grove, BoDo, the Basque Block and more, The Grove Hotel places you where you want to be for business & leisure.

Whether its the breathtaking mountain or skyline views, our beautifully renovated 250 guest rooms & suites or a culinary escape in Trillium Restaurant, your stay at The Grove Hotel & the City of Trees will leave you yearning to return soon.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Step into The Grove Hotel and experience the unrivaled style in downtown Boise, ID. Attached to the 5,400-seat Idaho Central Arena and adjacent to the Boise Centre, The Grove puts you just steps from the city's best shopping and restaurants.

The Hilton Garden Inn - Boise Spectrum hotel features include the Garden Grille & Bar, Room service from 5pm - 9pm, 24-hour Pavilion Pantry, Pavilion Lounge, complimentary airport shuttle service (runs from 6am to 11pm), complimentary parking, complimentary 24-hour business service, heated indoor pool and whirlpool, 24-hour Fitness Center and in-room Stay Fit Kits, four state-of-the-art meeting rooms for groups from five to 300, and complimentary USA Today newspapers each weekday morning.

The Hilton Garden Inn - Boise Spectrum hotel has meeting rooms with modern technology, on-site catering for breakfast, lunch and dinner, and a dedicated sales team to focus on the details of your event, from a small board meeting to a special wedding day.

The Hilton Garden Inn - Boise Spectrum hotel location has easy on and off access to I-84 and is minutes away from restaurants, movie theaters, the Boise greenbelt, skiing, and golf...

The 122-key Hotel Renegade will awaken your inner rebel, indulge your adventurous spirit and satisfy your urge to explore.  We’re paving a new path in Boise. Experience a boutique hotel stay unlike any other – where rough meets refined and details matter.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: Experience the premier all-suite Boise hotel at the SpringHill Suites Boise ParkCenter, the perfect balance of comfort, style, and convenience. name: La Quinta & Suites by Wyndham Boise Towne Square

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
When the first Langham Hotel opened in London, in 1865, it astonished Victorian London with the scope of its luxury, technology and grandeur. It was the first grand hotel to offer afternoon-tea service, as well as being the first with an elevator and first to introduce air conditioning.

The Langham, Chicago is part of the collection of Langham Hotels including The Langham Boston, Langham Place 5th Avenue (formerly The Setai), and other properties in Auckland, Boston, China, Hong Kong, London, Los Angeles, Melbourne, and Sydney.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: With its convenient downtown location, The Langham, Chicago gracefully blends urban sophistication with refined luxury. attributes.about_this_biz_bio:

I grew up in Chicago and returned home in 1996 after earning an Urban Studies degree from Brown University. I began running the Wicker Park Inn in 2004. We are staffed with amazing innkeepers and our impeccable cleaning staff. Thank you for choosing to stay with us.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:

You'll enjoy the best of both worlds with luxurious guest rooms, opulent suites, uncompromising service and world-class amenities, plus all the high tech extras you've come to rely on. We look forward to welcoming you.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
In the mid 1800's, Jonathon and Alice Stewart lived as tenants in a small, one story dwelling on the site of the current Nestle Inn.  In 1896, Jonathon, a carpenter, built their residence as a two family home adjoining two structures together so that their families could live close to each other.  They lived in the home until 1910.  The entire house was then rented to a long series of short-term tenants. Undocumented, but repeated history says the house also served as a boarding house for young women who came to Indianapolis during the turn of the century to work at the Real Silk glove/hosiery factory located close by on Park street.
In 2000, the house was restored as a five room Bed and Breakfast by the previous innkeepers.
In September of 2011, Robert and Leesa Smith purchased the Inn, added a room and have modernized the B&B experience for today's travelers amidst downtown Indy's Mass Avenue's art and theatre district of independent restaurants, pubs and shopping
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:

In your room will be your breakfast voucher which you can take with you as your breakfast is included in your room rate. 2) On weekends, breakfast is served at the cofee shop next door to us or you can go to Louie's Wine Dive on Mass Ave.  In your room will be your breakfast voucher which you can take with you as your breakfast is included in your room rate.
We have a bike share service and an electric car share service at our front door so getting around downtown, going to the Convention center (under 1 mile) or Lucas Oil is no problem.

Comfort, Exceptional Service.

Throughout our Inn you will see hardwood floors, high ceilings, wainscoting, crown molding, original wavy glass windows and a beautiful ornate open staircase. In not wanting our home to have a museum feel, we achieved a homey quality by painting each room with vibrant colors, adding lots of eclectic furnishings and keeping antiques to a minimum. attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: For 30 years, The Brick Street Inn has provided guests with warm Hoosier hospitality. Nestled among the quaint shops and eateries along the Village of Zionsville's brick Main Street, the Inn's historic charm and upscale bed and breakfast style accommodations are one-of-a-kind. We cordially invite you to experience the true peace of such an encounter at The Brick Street Inn in the Village of Zionsville.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: Jay Hartz grew up in the city of St Louis Missouri.  At a young age, he was surrounded by many Italian Eateries and started working for the Ponticello Family as a Dishwasher/Pizza cook at the age of 13.  It was at that time he was determined to follow a career in the Hospitality Industry.  Throughout High School and College, Jay worked his way up in the Food & Beverage side of the hotel industry.  After College, his career blossomed as he worked in every department of the Hotel  business and eventually became a General Manager.  From there, Jay soon got into Multi-Unit Hotel Management.  Most recently, he had dedicated his career to the Sales & Marketing side of the Hotel World as he was the Vice President of Sales for over 36 hotels in the USA.   With over 35 years of experience in the Hotel/Restaurant Industry, Jay decided to purchase his own hotel.  He and his wife Denise re-opened The Hotel Pattee in November of 2013.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: After years of being widely underutilized, Steve Holtze and Angela Harrington purchased the beautiful building from the city in 2016 and set out to repurpose it into a boutique hotel and event venue.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Hotel Grinnell is an adaptive reuse of the old junior high school in downtown Grinnell. The building was erected in 1921 as an addition to the high school, with three stories of classrooms, a large gymnasium and an auditorium. The high school was torn down in 1980, but the newer junior high was saved and remodeled into a community center that housed various offices.

After years of being widely underutilized, Steve Holtze and Angela Harrington purchased the beautiful building from the city in 2016 and set out to repurpose it into a boutique hotel and event venue.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Hotel Grinnell is more than just a place to stay; it embraces and celebrates the contrast and contradictions of old and new. Erected in 1921, the building served as the city's junior high school until the late '70s. Nearly 40 years later, it has been repurposed into an independently owned hotel, eatery, bar, and event center. When you stay at Hotel Grinnell, you'll sleep in an old classroom. The former locker rooms have been transformed into a bar, and the old scoreboard now decorates the lounge. The old gymnasium has a new life as a modern ballroom, and the auditorium is now a lively venue for performances, conferences, and weddings. Hotel Grinnell believes there's something special about soaking in the history of this old building, and we have taken care to add thoughtful touches of the original school throughout. Come find out how Hotel Grinnell merges old-school tradition with new-school attitude.

Welcome to Hilton Des Moines Downtown, an artfully bright and modern hotel. Part of the Des Moines Skywalk system, the hotel is connected to the Iowa Events Center - perfect for convention attendees - and offers quick access to offices, local dining, and Des Moines attractions. We have plenty of conveniences for your stay, including a signature restaurant, indoor pool, fitness center, and 14,000 sq. ft. of stylish event space.

It's easy to work or relax in our modern guest rooms. Draw the black-out curtains for a great night's sleep, then greet the day with a cup of coffee. Wi-Fi access, a 50-inch TV, a large workspace, MP3 connectivity, an in-room safe, and deluxe bath products add comfort to your stay.

Our Des Moines hotel has guests covered. Take a dip in the heated indoor pool, or work out in the complimentary, 24-hour fitness center. Our convenience shop and business center are open 24 hours, and we're happy to provide highchairs, cribs, and dining menus for children. attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Christopher McCord, an Ellinwood, KS native, is the proud owner of The Historic Wolf Hotel. He never dreamed he would own The Wolf Hotel, but now he is living his life around it. With lots of hopes and dreams for the future, McCord has repurposed and restored the Wolf Hotel. "The Underground" saloon and bar is located in the tunnels and has been fully restored and is functional each weekend. Chris continues to work each day to go the extra mile for his customers and the hotel.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: Stay in our well appointed suite or one of the four other lovely private rooms, take a tour and learn about the history of the Ellinwood underground tunnels, relax in the underground bar with a nightcap and wake up to help yourself to a scrumptious continental breakfast. The Historic Wolf Hotel will not disappoint! Book your getaway today!
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: The Wolf Hotel was built in 1894 by John Wolf. Today, The Historic Wolf Hotel serves as a bed and breakfast style hotel and full service event center. We offer a variety of fun events on a monthly basis with comedy shows and murder mystery dinners being just some of the fun! Our five guest rooms are well appointed and will take you back in time. Just the break you need from your busy life. Most rooms have a private bath, while all of them offer free WiFi, continental breakfast, satellite television, and beautiful antique furnishings. Our charming underground tunnel saloon is open every weekend for roaring good times and specialty drinks or pick a book off of our shelf and enjoy a quiet evening in your room with a bottle of wine. Schedule your next board meeting, private party, wedding, or reunion at our hotel and your guests will be impressed. Let us take care of the details!

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
The Inn is on the National Register of Historic Places and is a former Maine Governer and Government Senators family home.  If you ever saw the the 3 time Golden Globe and 5 time Oscar award winning film "The Aviator" starring Leonardo De Caprio as Howard Hughes then you will of seen Alan Alda from MASH playing the Senator that was in charge of the Government task force that tried to bring Howard Hughes down in political history. In that film Alan Alda played Senator and also Governor Ralph Owen Brewster and its his home we have so its pretty historic.

Our Inn was shown on TV across the USA on HGTV in June 2008 as we were filmed for their show HGTV "If Walls Could Talk" in Oct 2007.

Presidents Truman and Taft, 7 Senators that we're aware of and Louis B Mayer founder of MGM Films have all been and stayed here. 
The house was redesigned in 1934 by Maine and New Englands most famous architect John Calvin Stevens

Nestled in the mountains and overlooking Phillips Lake, The Lucerne Inn is in one of the most beautiful locations in Maine. Located right at the Inn is a picturesque golf course, a large outdoor swimming pool, beautiful gazebos and outdoor patios. Very few people are able to drive by this stunning 200-year-old Inn without stopping. And the fine dining and accommodations, stunning scenery and excellent New England hospitality make it worth stopping for . . . again and again.

Located conveniently between Bangor and Bar Harbor, The Lucerne Inn is only 15 minutes from downtown Bangor and access to great shopping, entertainment, museums and other attractions. The Inn is also just 15 minutes from Ellsworth and less than an hour from Bar Harbor and beautiful Acadia National Park. Whether visiting Bangor or heading Downeast consider lodging with us.

Just beyond our doors, the city unfurls: the charming streets of historic Mount Vernon, the vibrant waterfront, boutiques, restaurants, galleries, theatres and coffee shops. Nowhere in America is there a city like Baltimore, and nowhere in this city is there a hotel anything like The Ivy. The Ivy Hotel is a luxury boutique hotel, and home to Magdalena, a new star among Baltimore restaurants. attributes.about_this_biz_history: Located in the impeccably restored home of a brick baron, Rachael's Dowry is as elegant today as it was when it hosted George & Martha Washington in 1798. With beautiful gardens, a comfortable library and parlor, and a quiet location right in downtown Baltimore, you'll want to call Rachael's Dowry home.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Within walking distance of Baltimore's Inner Harbor sits the lovely neighborhood of Ridgely's Delight. Here, where charming, 19th century houses frame the tree-lined streets, is nestled your home away from home. Operating as a bed and breakfast since 2010, Rachael's Dowry boasts beautifully renovated accommodations as comfortable as they are enchanting. Our walls house traditions of laughter, bliss, and history -- if they could speak, they'd likely tell you about the home's links to the Underground Railroad and even George Washington's stay in 1798! Today, with homemade breakfast every morning, a relaxing atmosphere, and kind staff, we genuinely enjoy making your stay far more than wonderful.

name: Kimpton Hotel Monaco Baltimore Inner Harbor

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
"There's a strong identity that sets this city apart from its neighbors," says the General Manager of Four Seasons Hotel Baltimore.  "Baltimore may not have the cultural reputation of New York or DC, but it has distinct charms and its own identity.  Its citizens are genuine and very proud of their city and its history."

Julien Carralero had a positive experience getting a sense of the city's pace and culture.  Arriving a year before the opening, he settled into an office just down the hall from the Hotel's owners who had a great feel for what they wanted.  "It was beneficial and productive to have such open communication in coordinating the many details of a hotel opening."

Carralero studied hotel management because he liked creating memorable experiences for guests.  While many of his colleagues switched career fields he was too taken with his career choice to try anything else. Now he is embracing Baltimore's culture, which includes indulging in the city's famous delicacy, crab!
attributes.about_this_biz_history: Four Seasons Hotel Baltimore officially opened on November 14, 2011.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Hugging the shoreline, with unmatched views across the water, Four Seasons Hotel Baltimore offers a chic, five star, resort-like getaway in the heart of Harbor East, the city's hippest new district.  Explore upscale dining, entertainment and shopping in this vibrant, strollable neighborhood.  Meet or dine over sparkling blue water views.  Luxuriate in the Spa, or lounge in the pool oasis overlooking the marina. 

The 256 spacious hotel guest rooms include 45 well appointed suites.  Referred to as the "crown jewel of Harbor East," Four Seasons Hotel Baltimore is located directly overseeing the Inner Harbor.  The reception desk and the Lobby are located on the ground floor.  Two Michael Mina restaurants, LAMILL Coffee and Wit & Wisdom are located to the right of the Front Desk and have expansive views of the harbor through large bay windows.  The function and meeting space is on the second floor and feautres of 20,000 square feet of total function space.
With 107 beautifully restored guest rooms, a rooftop restaurant, cocktail lounge & karaoke room, and a coffee shop, the vibrant experience reflects and embraces its surrounding community.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: A symbol of Baltimore's historic past, reimagined for its future. Sagamore Pendry Baltimore is the reinvention of one of the region's most storied properties, perched on Recreation Pier in the center of the vibrant waterfront Fell's Point neighborhood. The hotel was carefully renovated and reimagined by Patrick Sutton Design with a creative vision rooted in its historic significance and signature Charm City allure.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Our storied 1914 property is perched on Baltimore's famed Recreation Pier - "Rec Pier" - in the heart of the dynamic Fell's Point neighborhood. The historically inspired setting reimagines the city's classic charm in a contemporary manner with luxurious interiors, Pendry signature personalized service, a stunning harbor front locale and a host of original dining destinations.

Enjoy dining options including our restaurant Watertable and Starbucks® beverages at The Ground Floor Cafe & Bar. Guests can stay fit at our 24-hour gym.

Whether you are walking to the Inner Harbor attractions or Baltimore Convention Center, watching an Orioles/Ravens game or enjoying a visit to the Horseshoe Casino, this urban retreat is a perfect place to relax.

Hampton Inn Baltimore-Downtown-Convention Center is an ideal hotel for patient's families and faculty/corporate visitors of the neighboring University of Maryland Medical Center and UMAB. Visitors can take a stroll and explore the 'charm city' locale filled with historical, cultural and shopping opportunities. You should visit Baltimore's Lexington Market at least once. BWI and Ft. Meade are easy trips, both just 10 miles south of our Hampton Inn hotel on Route 295. The hotel is also ideally located 0.9 miles from the Horseshoe Casino.

Relax enjoy the hotel's sports inspired contemporary décor - with a twist. Can you find the baseball sphere re-interpreted in our Hampton Inn hotel's rich textiles? Accenting the striking color palette of crimson and sage green are whimsical touches throughout.

Our Baltimore, Maryland hotel features 126 rooms, including suites, each featuring a coffeemaker, hair dryer, flat panel LCD HDTV with premium cable and movie channels, microwave, refrigerator, complimentary wired internet and WiFi, two telephones with voicemail and iron and ironing board...

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Owners Warren and David desired to own a Bed and Breakfast for many years. After meeting and "talking about it" for several years, they finally decided that it was time to stop talking! After a year of searching for the perfect B and B, they discovered INN at 2920 and knew this was "the one."

Warren received his degree in Hospitality Management and Food Technology from Sophia College, Bombay. He went on to work for two luxury hotel chains - Taj Group of Hotels and Oberoi Hotels & Resorts in India and England. He moved to the USA when he was offered a job with Carnival Cruise Lines where he worked for 7 years. A visit to Washington DC one summer ended with Warren moving to Washington and working for Hilton Hotels followed by the Four Seasons Hotel in Georgetown. He has worked every facet of the hotel industry, most recently as a Human Resources Director. His knowledge of, experience in and passion for hospitality is evident in everything he does, especially owning a B & B.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
INN at 2920, a distinctively contemporary boutique B & B in downtown Baltimore, provides guests with a unique fusion of vintage Baltimore architecture and modern urban chic. A comfortable mix of old and new is reflected in the decor of our 3,800 square foot row home as well as in our amenities. INN at 2920 has been featured in ELLE Decor, NY Times, & Southern Living, twice voted Baltimore's Best B&B, and is a top 3 B&B on tripadvisor.com.

2920 Elliott Street dates back to the 1880's. For many years it served as a tavern on the 1st floor and as a Brothel upstairs! It's true - the 2nd and 3rd floors included a matrix of 20 to 30 rooms, prior to renovations in the 1990's. Only an entrance from the alley allowed access to the upper floors.

Through a careful and thoughtful process, INN at 2920 has been transformed and now houses a tastefully renovated, comfortable, contemporary, and stylish boutique Bed and Breakfast in Baltimore - one that must be experienced to be best appreciated.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: INN at 2920, Baltimore's Boutique Bed and Breakfast Hotel, provides a distinctively contemporary experience for both leisure visitors and business travelers! In 1900, the hotelier and impresario Lucias Boomer (best known as the owner of New York's Waldorf - Astoria) began work on what was to be the most luxurious hotel in New England. Eight months and $1,100,000 later, The Lenox, the tallest building in Boston at the time, opened its doors in the heart of Back Bay and a proud tradition was born.

Over the next century, The Lenox became a home-away-from-home to luminaries in entertainment, business, sports, and the arts - and came to occupy a prominent and cherished role in Boston society.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: The Lenox Hotel offers clean & safe boutique hotel accommodations in downtown Boston's Back Bay. Our historic hotel first opened in 1898, recently renovated with all of the modern and luxurious amenities you would expect from an environmentally friendly hotel in Boston. Featuring beautiful spaces for Weddings in downtown Boston, Meetings & Receptions at our Event Venues; the Lenox is the perfect hotel for a special occasion in Boston. Get more information on boutique hotel suites in downtown Boston on the Lenox Hotel website. We look forward to your reservation!

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
The story of the Verb Hotel is one that began way back in 1959 when the Fenway Motor Hotel first opened its doors at 1271 Boylston Street. Located deep in the heart of Boston's Fenway neighborhood, the two-story building was designed to 1950s modernist ideals by architects Irving Salsberg and Ralph Leblanc.

Through the decades, the hotel's status as a home town icon kept growing, like a cool local personality who's seen it all and has the characteristic looks to prove it! So it was out of a deep-felt respect for our past, coupled with our wild imagination for what could be, that our dream to breathe new life into the hotel took shape. Our ambition: To return the site to its rightful place as the home of Fenway's legends and good times while injecting it with all the things our modern guests could want. Enter The Verb Hotel.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Get ready to rock your trip to Boston with a stay at The Verb. This boutique, music-themed hotel offers a retro vibe and modern amenities mere steps from Fenway Park. Stay cool in the seasonal outdoor pool and enjoy sushi & sake at Hojoko, the onsite Japanese izakaya.

All food is made with the freshest ingredients, and wines and beers are carefully selected from around the country.

Located in the forward-thinking Kendall Square neighborhood, alongside MIT and major tech firms, The Kendall is a piece of preserved history amidst technology. In homage of the independence of the Black Sheep, The Kendall, with Queen Anne-style architecture, remains one of the area's only 19th century buildings. It is a member of Historic Hotels of America, and on the National Register of Historic

attributes.about_this_biz_history: The Boston Harbor Hotel is Boston's landmark, waterfront hotel located at Rowes Wharf overlooking historic Boston Harbor. With the revitalization of the waterfront and building of the Rose Kennedy Greenway, Rowes Wharf is one of the most distinguished addresses in Boston. The Boston Harbor Hotel stands as a gateway to and from the harbor. Private yachts from around the world and events such as Sail Boston and the BT Global Challenge call the wharf home. Rowes Wharf has become an integral part of the city of Boston where "merchants" of the financial world meet. The property has been awarded the Forbes Travel Guide Five Star Award. The Boston Harbor Hotel is a member of Preferred Hotels & Resorts Worldwide and has been honored as one of the "World's Best Places to Stay" on the Condé Nast Traveler Gold List .

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Fifteen Beacon occupies the site of the former Bromfield Mansion, built in 1722 by wealthy Boston merchant Edward Bromfield, Jr. The present building was originally constructed in 1903, designed by renowned Boston architect William Gibbons Preston (c.1842-1910).

Preston's best-known buildings include the New England Museum of Natural History (now Louis Boston) in Back Bay and the International Trust Company Building. Former tenants include the Boston Transit Commission (1905), Rapid Transit Commission (1906), and Boston School Committee, which occupied the building from 1923 until 1999, when it became Fifteen Beacon Hotel.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Within this elegant architectural gem, XV Beacon guests encounter authentic genuine service honed for modern technological needs, handsome interiors, signature amenities, a green policy that practices environmental conservation and eco-friendly products, and sincere friendliness among the entire dynamic staff.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Hotel Manager who takes pride in his hotel and the staff for the outstanding accomodations and service that they provide to the guests.

attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: He has a team of dedicated staff that runs a luxurious hotel like clockwork and he signs his name with a large cursive H. You won't find these prices anywhere else. The Hotel Indigo does a fantastic job of telling the neighborhood story through the entire hotel. Starting in the lobby we have an art gallery with local rotating art. The restaurant and bar area feature commissioned art work hanging on the walls and sculptures placed through out for the guest to enjoy while dining. Each room has an accent wall of art unique to the area. Hotel Indigo Kansas City - The Crossroads takes its inspiration from the city's thriving creative scene by incorporating local artwork throughout its three-story building. The 81 guest rooms of this historically certified, former home of the KC Costume Company, are embellished by custom fabric headboards and specially commissioned art, including a framed paint brush. The latter is a nod to Jim Leedy who in 1985 opened the first gallery in the Crossroads in what was once a paint brush factory. He is among the local creative types who have helped shape the unique experience of staying at the Hotel Indigo Kansas City Crossroads.

attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
An Art Deco masterpiece in the heart of downtown, the Hotel Phillips is a popular choice with guests who appreciate the charm and character of a grand and historic hotel. The hotel's address was once occupied by a haberdashery operated by President Harry S. Truman and his brother. Today, the hotel's top floor suite is named in his honor.

Built in the 1930's, this 20-story luxury hotel, a national landmark, continues to exude all the elegance of the period with modern amenities. Many of the original details remain, including the walnut paneling, intricate metalwork, 20-story mail chute, Art Deco light fixtures and a gilded winged statue of the goddess Dawn.

The 216 rooms are cozy, characteristic of a historic hotel, and comfortable, with modern amenities such as complimentary WiFi, multiple charging outlets, flat screen TVs, plump duvets, high-end linens, C.O Bigelow bath products and Keurig coffee.

The hotel's highly celebrated restaurant, Tavernonna Italian Kitchen, serves chef driven breakfast and dinner menus and happy hour, Sneak down to the 1930's inspired speakeasy bar, P.S., through the hidden entrance near the front desk for craft cocktails and small bites.

Additional amenities include a business center, room service, a 24-hour gym, massages available by appointment, and event space rental available by reservation with the sales team. Valet parking is available for a fee...

The Northern Hotel's enduring story began in 1902 when P.B. Moss and Colonel Henry W. Rowley began construction on what was to be the most modern hotel in Montana. The hotel was completed in 1904, and enjoyed over three decades of prosperity, until the fall of 1940 when it burned to the ground in a sudden fire. But like a phoenix from the ashes, the Northern Hotel rose again, more sophisticated and beautiful than ever. In 2006, the Northern was put up for sale and subsequently purchased in 2009 by the Nelson brothers, Mike and Chris. Through a visionary mission, the brothers brought the Northern back to life in 2013 and, once again, made it the most modern and luxurious hotel in Montana.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
The Mizpah Hotel was built in 1907, shortly after the town of Tonopah was founded at the start of the great Nevada silver strike. The hotel quickly became a hub for lodging, libations and entertainment to fuel the mining frenzy. After more than one hundred years of ups and downs, transfers of ownership and natural calamities, Fred and Nancy Cline purchased the Mizpah in early 2011.

Like most of their endeavors, the Mizpah Hotel has special meaning for the Clines. Nancy's great uncle was pioneer Harry Ramsey, a miner by trade. He came to Tonopah in 1900 to seek a future in silver and was later joined in 1904 by his sister Emma, Nancy's grandmother. Emma eventually moved to the San Francisco Bay Area where she met and married Nancy's grandfather, George Bunting, a sea captain for Standard Oil. Today, the Clines are thankful to be a part of the revitalization of Tonopah--Nancy's ancestral hometown--and the rebirth of the Mizpah.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Experience historic elegance and comfort in Nevada's breathtaking high desert! A treasured destination since 1907, The Mizpah Hotel in Tonopah is better known as the "Jewel of the Desert". Beautifully renovated by Nancy and Fred Cline in 2011, The Mizpah Hotel takes you back in time, but also offers modern amenities for a comfortable stay.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: Adair Country Inn and Restaurant is rich in history, with scenic grounds, walking trails, and colorful gardens designed by the Olmsted Brothers (sons of the man who designed New York City's Central Park), providing an atmosphere of quiet splendor. The country estate was built in 1927 by Frank Hogan as a gift to his only daughter, Dorothy Adair Hogan, upon the occasion of her marriage to John W. Guider. Joel and Cathy Bedor are the current owners, and Cynthia Foster and Tom Lapointe serve as the Innkeepers of this romantic country inn and restaurant.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Welcome to Adair Country Inn and Restaurant! Adair is an intimate and romantic retreat for couples who wish to relax, observe wildlife, and take advantage of nearby hiking, skiing, and the natural attraction of New Hampshire's White Mountains. 

From our long drive bordered by stately pines, gleaming white birch trees, and stone walls to our picturesque setting on a knoll with spectacular views of the White Mountains, Adair is one of New England's most renowned country inns. The Inn's relaxing ambiance and casual dress belie uncompromising attention to detail, highly personalized, warm service. Guests are welcome to enjoy the Inn's full facilities, including the 200-acre grounds, library bar, living room, and granite tap room with pool table and large screen television.

Adair Country Inn and Restaurant offers award winning New England style cuisine in a cozy fireside atmosphere.

Deliberately small and naturally quiet, Adair Country Inn and Restaurant is the perfect New England retreat. We welcome you to visit us soon!

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
HISTORY OF THE COOPERS
 
Jim and Ibby Cooper, owners and proprietors, came to Thorn Hill from hospitality and education careers in California, Michigan, Texas, and Florida. Their older children--excited to be involved--fit right in with a lifestyle that seems less a business than a constant round of entertaining good friends. Jim grew up in California where his family was involved in the ski business in the Sierras. He attended the University of Denver in Hotel and Restaurant Management where he met Ibby who was a graduate of Loretta Heights College. Ibby was a special education teacher along the way and set up a special project in Orlando. It was a special school for the homeless right in their own complex.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
INN AT THORN HILL HISTORY

In the later part of the 19th century, Katherine Prescott Wormeley (1830-1908) a distinguished translator of Balzac, first acquired property in Jackson Village on the hill above the present day Inn.  She engaged the renowned New York architectural firm of McKim & White to design a year round residence which was complete by 1891.  The present proprietors, Jim and Ibby Cooper, purchased the Inn in 1992.  They are steadfastly committed to preserving the Inn's rich heritage, enhancing its architectural integrity and assiduously maintaining the high standards of lodging, dining and hospitality that have been set by past owners and to reach for new heights to become the quintessential country inn.  The visitor to the Inn will continue to see improvements in the facilities, but more importantly, will come to savor the delights of warm hospitality and professional service.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: The Inn is the #2 rated resort in the Continental United States with great guest rooms, fine dining, an award winning wine list and a complete spa. Our eight double occupancy cabins and one quad occupancy cabin are nestled on a small property providing a relaxing atmosphere. Most cabins have a fireplace and enclosed porch that overlooks the Pemigewasset River. All cabins are non smoking and range from single room cabins with a refrigerator and microwave to one bedroom cabins with a livingroom and fully equipped kitchen. All cabin bathrooms include a toilet, sink and shower. All linens are provided. Each cabin has a cable TV, charcoal grill, picnic table and lawn chairs.

Nearby Attractions Include:

The Whale's Tale Waterpark - literally across the street!
SledVentures Snowmobile Rental - right next door!
Franconia Notch State Park & Flume Gorge - 1.6 Miles Away (3 minute drive)
Clark's Trading Post - 1.8 Miles Away (3 minute drive)
Hobo Railroad - 2.5 Miles Away (5 minute drive)
Alpine Adventures Zip Line & Offroad Tours - 3 Miles Away (6 minute drive)
Cafe Lafayette Dinner Train -  3.5 Miles Away (7 minute drive)
Kancamangus Highway Entrance - 3.9 Miles Away (8 minute drive)
Loon Mountain - 5.6 Miles Away (11 minute drive)
Cannon Mountain - 8.4 Miles Away (11 minute drive)
Lost River Gorge & Boulder Caves - 8.6 Miles Away (14 minute drive)

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: We met in Boston, lived in NYC for 15 years and decided to leave busy careers for a new adventure.  Being innkeepers and the stewards of this historic and beautiful property has been all the adventure we hoped for.  Come visit!

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: A seven year journey that included studies in hotel and restaurant management and a season spent as resident innkeepers at an inn in Vermont finally brought us to the special village of Jackson and the Inn at Ellis River. Frank and our staff focus full time on creating the hospitality for which the inn is known. In addition to innkeeping, Lyn continues in her role as a professor at Kansas State University, teaching via the web in a multi-university graduate program in gerontology.Creating a special place for our guests to enjoy remains our greatest goal
attributes.about_this_biz_history: The inn began life as the home of Alice and Andrew Harriman and their family. Harriman, a talented carpenter, built the farmhouse in 1893 along the banks of the Ellis River, The home has a long history of hospitality to visitors. In the first half of the 20th century, their descendants opened their home to board summer visitors and employees of surrounding resorts, inns, and lodges. In 1985, the property was transformed from a farmhouse on the river into a six room bed and breakfast. One hundred years after its original construction the building was expanded with the addition of 13 guest rooms (many with jacuzzis and fireplaces), the cozy gameroom and pub, our sunny breakfast room, and lobby. In 2001, the original carriage house was replaced with the two newest guest rooms overlooking the river. The long tradition of warm hospitality begun over a century ago continues with 21st century amenities at the Inn at Ellis River.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Welcome to Our Bed and Breakfast in Beautiful Jackson, New Hampshire

Nestled by a mountain stream at the edge of Jackson, a classic New England village, the Inn at Ellis River is your perfect choice for a weekend getaway, skiing or hiking vacation, or to celebrate any special occasion. Choose from the inn's 20 rooms and rustic cottage, many with a two-person Jacuzzi and/or balcony and most with a fireplace. Awaken to clear mountain air and a gourmet country breakfast in our sunny dining room. You can relax and unwind in our cozy game room and pub, sitting room, atrium-enclosed hot tub overlooking the river, sauna, or in summer, the gazebo and outdoor heated swimming pool.

The quiet, relaxed, cozy atmosphere makes this a great romantic retreat.

     Yankee Magazine Editor's Pick!

You're in the heart of the White Mountains, so you can spend your days exploring nearby Mount Washington, waterfalls and covered bridges, scenic drives, hiking, golfing, canoeing, fishing, mountain biking, tax-free shopping in North Conway, or just relaxing. In winter, cross-country ski, snowshoe, take a sleigh ride, snowmobile, or choose from one of five alpine ski centers nearby. Join us at the Inn at Ellis River, an award-winning romantic B&B, for a mountain getaway in Jackson ~ New Hampshire's best kept secret.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: First built in 1763 as part of the New Hampshire homestead act the property has had a number of uses. attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
A native of Zurich, Switzerland, Koeppel grew up in the hospitality business - his parents owned and operated a restaurant. He moved permanently to the United States in the mid 70's with a degree from the renowned Hotel Management School fo Lausanne, Switzerland. 
Koeppel has more than 20 years of hospitality experience, having worked eight years with Ritz Carlton Hotels and eight years with Four Seasons. In 1990 Koeppel decided to pursue his dreams of owning a hotel. He moved from the very famous Banff Springs Hotel where he was General Manager. His basic requirements included property with a three season environment, near mountains, with access to a gofl course and close to water. He looked at every available property with more than 35 rooms and a restaurant in Vermont, New Hampshire and Maine. He found his ideal location tucked away in historic Jackson Village - The Wentworth.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: Joshua Trickey built The Wentworth in 1869 as a wedding gift to his daughter Georgia and her husband to-be, General Marshall Wentworth. Wentworth had served as a General for the Union FOrces in the Civil War and wanted to settle in the tranquility of the Mount Washington Valley. Over the years the Wentworth's added the Arden Cottage, Wentworth Hall Thornycroft, Wildwood Cottage and Glen-Thorn. Eventually the complex included 39 buildings and was called Wentworth Hall. For many years, Wentworth Hall was a self sustaining complex that accommodated up to 400 people and included an electric plant, a farm, greenhouses, a dairy and pasteurization plant, a laundry, a blacksmith, a garage with mechanics, a casino, a golf course and more. The Wentworth Golf Course, built in 1895 was the first in the region with 6 holes. It was later expanded to 18 holes. By the 1920's Jackson had become one of the most popular resort destinations in the northeast with up to 40 trains per day delivering guests.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Nestled in the majestic White Mountains of Jackson, New Hampshire, The Wentworth is a charming, 61-room inn within close proximity to cross country skiing, a stunning golf course and an abundance of year-round, outdoor activities.
