attributes.about_this_biz_bio: There are now two generations of the Rembe Family that own and operate the historic Los Poblanos Ranch. In 1976, Penny and Armin Rembe purchased one half of the property from Albert and Barbara Simms, where they raised their four children and maintained the property as gentlemen farmers. In 1999, the second half of the property, which included La Quinta Cultural Center, came up for sale and was under threat of being developed. Together with their four children and their families, the decision was made to reunite the properties and undertake a plan to preserve the buildings, gardens, and open farmland in perpetuity. In their retirement, Penny and Armin ran the inn for five years. In 2004, son Matthew Rembe became Executive Director and has overseen and developed all areas of the business, from developing a wholesale lavender business to the addition of guest rooms, fine dining, and cultural programming.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Set among 25 acres of lavender fields and lush formal gardens, Los Poblanos Inn is one of the most prestigious historic properties in the Southwest. It was designed by the region's foremost architect, John Gaw Meem, the "Father of Santa Fe Style," and is listed on both the New Mexico and National Registers of Historic Places. Guest rooms are in a classic New Mexican style with kiva fire places, carved ceiling beams, hardwood floors, and antique New Mexican furnishings. Guests can relax around the Spanish hacienda-style courtyard or spend hours exploring the property's extensive gardens and organic farm. The buildings feature significant artwork commissioned during the WPA period by some of New Mexico's most prominent artists, including a fresco by Peter Hurd and carvings by Gustave Baumann.
Both Campo and Farm Shop are open daily, call 505-344-9297 for hours.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Historic Inn, Field-to-Fork Dining, Private Celebrations, Organic Farm, Lavender Fields

attributes.about_this_biz_history: Built in the Italianate architecture style, the facility was originally designated to treat employees of the Atchison, Topeka & Santa Fe Railway company. Often referred to as the Robert DeNiro hotel, it was originally conceived by both DeNiroand Ira Drukier.
Each room features different hotel furniture, and they have a range of cultural influences, from hand-loomed, Tibetan silk rugs to English leather settees. All beds are Duxiana from Sweden. The bathrooms use patterns of hand laid Moroccan tile or Italian Carrara marble.
The Greenwich Hotel prides itself on its state of the art, modern technology alongside the hotel's old-world charm. attributes.about_this_biz_history: Decades before The Dunhill Hotel would open, local architect Louis Asbury Sr. was entranced by the great Italian craftsmen who created cathedrals famous for their soaring, elegant roof lines. Today, The Dunhill Hotel stands distinct on the Charlotte skyline, an amalgam of American, British, and Italian influences, something those with an eye for period detail can detect. Opened in 1929 as the Mayfair Manor apartment hotel, with half of its original 100 rooms permanent residences, today's Dunhill Hotel is a thoughtful evolution. A full restoration was recently completed, and various on-going aesthetic improvements all share a common goal--to celebrate the original vision of Mr. Asbury, with a nod to the needs of the modern traveler.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
An oasis of calm amid the hustle and bustle of Uptown Charlotte, The Dunhill Hotel is steeped in historic tradition and surrounded by modern significance. Located at the heart of Charlotte's Uptown, The Dunhill Hotel is just steps from the Time Warner Cable Arena, North Carolina Blumenthal Center for the Performing Arts, Spirit Square Center for the Arts, as well as many other popular museums and attractions.

Today, the elegant Dunhill Hotel is one of Charlotte's few remaining historic landmarks of that distinctive period in history. It provides visitors and guests with an ambiance reminiscent of a by gone era. The Dunhill successfully combines the elegance found in the luxury hotels of Europe with an American sense of comfort and service, creating a place where the guest experience is unsurpassed.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: After more than 100 years as a fraternal lodge and hotel, the building took on its current life in 2003 after a three-year renovation process. Since then, The Hotel Donaldson has become recognized for its exceptional hospitality and its role as a central location for downtown Fargo’s nightlife, dining, and culture.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
The Hotel Donaldson’s mission is to create a memorable experience through exceptional hospitality and service. Our team is available to help you with everything from reservations and directions to recommendations on local attractions, restaurants, theaters, sporting events, or anything else you need to enhance your stay and help you get around the Red River Valley.

At the Hotel Donaldson, we celebrate the arts in all their forms. The work of over 60 regional artists graces our premises. Each guest-room is designed and curated around the work of a single artist. Within each room, we have placed a biography folder and invite you to learn more about the artist featured in your room, as well as the other artists whose works appear throughout the property, including the restaurant.

World-class service with a personal touch marks every stay at the Hotel Donaldson. Amenities include 24/7 fitness center, high-speed wifi, pet friendly, rainfall shower heads, rooftop terrace, down bedding, complementary turndown service, breakfast delivery service, complementary wine and cheese hour, valet service, original art, and so much more.

If you’re looking for things to see and do around town, speak with anyone on our team. We’ll happily give you the scoop on local attractions, restaurants, special events and concerts. We’re here 24 hours a day, seven days a week, and look forward to making your visit to Fargo memorable and unique.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Originally built in 1927 as the AIU Citadel, the LeVeque Tower was architect Charles Howard Crane's masterpiece. At the time, the LeVeque Tower was the tallest skyscraper between New York City and Chicago, and the fifth tallest building in the world, even once serving as a beacon for Amelia Earhart. Previously home to the Deshler Wallick Hotel and later becoming known as the Lincoln LeVeque Tower, then simply the LeVeque Tower after its purchase in 1945. Clad in unusual terra cotta relief tiles, the LeVeque Tower's art deco design remains the city's most recognizable feature.  

Hotel LeVeque opened its doors on March 24, 2017 in downtown Columbus. Part of Autograph Collection Hotels, Hotel LeVeque joins the distinguished portfolio of more than 100 independent hotels around the world that are exactly like nothing else. 

With its views of the Columbus skyline and the Scioto Mile riverbank, the 149-room boutique hotel occupies floors five through 10 of the LeVeque Tower.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Our hotel is located in the historic LeVeque Tower in the heart of Downtown Columbus. Our unique decor and high end service makes us the top place to stay when traveling to Columbus.  We are located close by to Center of Science and Industry®, Palace Theatre and Ohio Theatre. In your downtime, relax in your luxury room with plush bedding, complimentary Wi-Fi and fitness center.

Home is where the hearth is and in downtown Columbus, that welcoming environment can be found at Hilton Columbus Downtown in the Short North Arts District adjacent to the Greater Columbus Convention Center. Here, travelers are invited to cultivate aspirations and create new stories. Well-being can be achieved in one of two fitness centers or the indoor saline pool. Relax at one of the many communal spaces including the lobby bar, Spark - the ideal spot to work, unwind, and connect. Ignite your appetite at FYR, the award-winning property's signature restaurant accessible from High Street, where every dish on the menu has a touch of fire. Elevate an evening out at Stories on High, the tallest outdoor rooftop bar in the city. Towering 28 stories high with two terraces offering sweeping views of downtown Columbus, guests are invited to toast the sky-high experience with inventive artisanal cocktails - all curated with intention. As part of Hilton Columbus Downtown's commitment to fostering creativity in the Short North Arts District, the hotel, in partnership with the Greater Columbus Convention Center, boasts an art collection comprised exclusively of Central Ohio artists, valued at nearly $6M. Cultivating collaboration and celebration is simple with over 75,000 sq ft of inspiring event and meeting space, including three ballrooms, over 22,000 sq. ft. of pre-function space, and 40 meeting and breakout rooms...

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
For Donna Marie Golden, those staying with her are much more than simply customers. They are, truly, Donna's personal guests. 
 
Ever since Donna opened her original Bed and Breakfast destination, she has been on a quest to constantly seek out the very best. As each unique new accommodation was created, word of the exceptional hospitality of Donna and her highly qualified staff spread. Couples have continued to flock to Donna's Premier Lodging for honeymoons, anniversaries, and to celebrate other momentous milestones in their lives. Couples and singles alike have enjoyed the extravagance of uninterrupted hours in front of crackling fireplaces or immersed in bubbling Jacuzzis. 

"My goal is to provide a wonderful getaway for couples to reunite and re-flame their love," says Donna Marie, her voice ringing with sincerity. "Everyday life can have a toll on relationships, and investing in your relationship can be the best investment a couple can make."
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
In 1988, Donna Marie Golden bought an Amish home that she intended to renovate into a rental property.  However, in the middle of renovations she decided to turn it into a Bed and Breakfast and in May of 1991 Donna's Country Bed and Breakfast opened for business.

Donna Marie interacted with many honeymoon and anniversary couples and was inspired to create accommodations with a more romantic atmosphere...complete with an in-room Jacuzzi and a gas log fireplace.  Donna Marie's vision soon came to reality and today, Donna's Premier Lodging boasts 17 accommodations (Cottages, Villas, Suites, Cabins and Chalets) all featuring an in-room Jacuzzi and a gas log fireplace - the perfect destination for a honeymoon or romantic get-a-way!

So drop the kids off at grandmas for the weekend and take some time to rekindle the fire and see for yourself why Donna's Premier Lodging is now the ultimate destination for romantic getaways.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Donna's Premier Lodging is the ultimate Amish Country Ohio getaway. With a focus on romance for couples, Donna's 17 spacious lodging options include cozy cabins and suites that come complete with Jacuzzi tubs and fireplaces. Accommodations also feature full kitchens or kitchenettes, and a continental breakfast is included.
Couples can luxuriate in Donna's Berlin, Ohio-based cabins, and spend time reconnecting outdoors -- or in. Cabins are located less than a mile from Berlin, Ohio. Guests can choose to meander around town or take in Amish Country's abundant natural wonders. Closer to town, suites provide a different type of Amish Country lodging experience, within walking distance to shops and dining. It's your destination for romance!

 We're two C-17 pilots who manage several crash pads in Altus AFB for your TDY lodging needs. Crash pads are an awesome alternative to staying on base at no additional cost to you. We think every house should have a ping pong table.

The current owners are more than pleased with the outcome and enjoyed using some of their own privately collected materials, such as the individual woods and stones used in each room, to decorate and personalize the motel. attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Rittenhouse 1715, A Boutique Hotel began as a 10 room Bed and  Breakfast in our Carriage House that was built in early 1900.  Originally this building was a horse stable for a wealthy family that lived around the corner.  Blueprints are available in lobby area showing the original stable.   

In early 2006 our property expanded by breaking through the walls to the townhouse next door which provided us with an additional 6 rooms.  Shortly after another 6 rooms were added by breaking through to the townhouse on the opposite side of the building bring the total to 22 guest rooms.  

Our new decor, new rooms had a boutique hotel feel about them, we upgraded to the finest in amenities and felt the name Bed & Breakfast was no longer appropriate.  We changed our name to better fit the service and product we had to offer.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Built between 1890 and 1900 as an upscale apartment hotel, having only 24 suites for an elite clientele of the day. When opened it was called the "Flanders Hotel" and had many prominent visitors seeking the best accommodations Philadelphia had to offer. In the early days guests arrived by horse-drawn carriages and were met at the curb by a uniformed footman.

The building was originally built with gas lighting fixtures, but shortly after opening at the turn of the century it was converted to electric lighting. It was one of the first high-rise buildings in Philadelphia to have an elevator installed.

More than 100 years later, and after a two-year, multi-million dollar restoration, we opened as the Alexander Inn. We made every effort to restore and maintain the original architectural elements of the building, while bringing the building up to the life safety standards of today. Craftsmanship of the day is abundant.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Hotel On Phillips was originally built as the Sioux Falls National Bank in 1918 and it continued to operate as a bank over the years. At the time it was built, it was the tallest building in South Dakota.  One hundred years later, in 2018, Hotel On Phillips began its restoration and transformation into an upscale chic boutique hotel featuring 90 unique and elegant guest rooms along with many luxury suites. 

When stepping into the lobby, you are taken back to the era of the early 1900's with its original historical designs.  The lobby houses its original chandeliers. The beautifully designed dentil tray ceilings feature rosettes and Greek Key design. Centered in the lobby is the original Bank Vault with its 16-ton door and 24-3 inch bolts. The Bank Vault has been opened up and become the walk-through entrance into the lounge – The Treasury.  
The Mezzanine overlooking the lobby, showcases replicated Skylights, seating areas, a business center, a fitness center, and Josiah's Library.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Hotel on Phillips is an upscale boutique hotel in the heart of downtown Sioux Falls.  Walk through our historic vault to enter The Treasury, a cocktail lounge that serves great food and drinks. Our café is open in the morning for pastries and drinks, and we are only a short walk away from dozens of restaurants.

about_this_biz_business_recommendation.description: The Capitol Grille, and adjoining Oak Bar, is the ideal place for Nashvillians "in the know".  Serving a Farm to Table menu with the freshest items.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
The Hotel Hermitage opened its doors on Saturday, Sept. 17, 1910. Each of the 250 rooms provided hot and cold circulating water, which was distilled to avoid typhoid. Each room had a private bath, telephone and electric fan. 

Only the finest materials were used: Italian sienna marble; wall panels of Russian walnut; a stained glass ceiling in the vaulted lobby. Downstairs, adjoining the Oak Bar, was The Capitol Grille. Originally planned as a rathskellar, it emerged as a private club for men only. 

It was the preferred gathering place for the city's socialites. It was the national platform for both pro- and anti-suffrage forces, and a national radio program originated from its famous dining room. The hotel became a social center for Nashville and a frequent stop for some of the nation's most prominent figures, from presidents to actresses and gangsters. From the early 20th century through the '30s and '40s, "Meet me at The Hermitage" could have been deemed the city's slogan.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Nashville's most original and longest standing hotel. Built in 1910 in a group effort by the community, our luxury Nashville hotel has been the backdrop for 106 years of traditions, memories, and iconic moments. As the top hotel in Tennessee and the most cherished, we look forward to being your home-away-from-home. Like the locals have said for more than a century, "Meet me at The Hermitage."

attributes.about_this_biz_history: Sara's Inn on the Boulevard (Sara's Inn) was originally a one story Victorian cottage. The original house was built before the turn of the century, and changed hands many times over the early years. In 1980, a second story with turret and widow's walk were added. Within the main house, the first and second floor centered around a staircase positioned under the cupola, producing a magnificent 3-story open space, flooded with light from above. For some time after the addition of the second story, the structure stood vacant and suffered severe deterioration. In 1983, Donna and Tillman Arledge purchased the property and began its restoration and conversion to a bed and breakfast inn. On Mother's Day weekend in May 1986, it was featured on the Heights Historical Home Tour, and the inn opened the following month.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
A native of Illinois, Edward Day Woodruff came to Utah in 1890 from Rock Springs, Wyoming where he had been a surgeon for the Union Pacific Railroad.
Mr Woodruff hired the prestigious architectural firm of Headlund and Wood to build his family's 11,000 square foot home. The second Renaissance Rivival style home, one of the grandest homes on Capitol Hill, was completed in 1906.
Fashioned after an English manor, the living room walls were covered with leather and canvas hand painted by famous local artist, William Culmer.
Decorated in the style of the period, the interior featured the finest cratsmanship of the day as well as Tiffany stained glass and Oriental rugs.
During the 1970's the house was divided into apartments that were later used for legal offices. 
In 1998, the Woodruff home became a Bed & Breakfast.The McCarthey family purchased the Inn in 2004 and meticulously restored its original loveliness while upgrading guest amenitites and adding modern conveniences.

Each room has remarkable character and is tastefully decorated to enhance the charm and comfort of your stay. You will enjoy down bedding on comfortable king or queen size beds, a large jetted tub in your private bathroom, TV/DVD/CD with cable access, WI-FI Internet access, luxurious towels, linens, plush robes, and Aveda bath and body products. about_this_biz_business_recommendation.description: Best pizza outside NYC, in old mill building, 20 kraft beers on tap, many great foods, made fresh, beyond pizza. Show Sleep Woodstock room key & save.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Patrick & Leslie decided it was time to start slowing down and enjoy what life had to offer outside of their NYC existence. Leslie, a Queens girl born and bred, Patrick, an art-side creative director, who went to NYC to attend Parsons School of Design and never left.

So what do they do--buy a motel in one of the prettiest places around--Woodstock VT. 

Now, after renovating this wonderful little 60's road-side motel, they plan to enjoy the area's beauty and people as well as all the people who decide to stay with them.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Sleep Woodstock Motel, Woodstock's Unexpected Motel, offers visitors fully renovated, modern, comfortable accommodations, park-at-your-door convenience with today's top amenities. 

Purchased in July 2013 the motel is owned and operated by Leslie Bowne and Patrick Fultz. A true motor inn, the motel offers 12 cozy and clean rooms that include 4 dog-friendly rooms. 

Constructed in 1959 by Abram Landis, the first pastor at Bridgewater's Bethany Mennonite Church, this bit of Americana has had a complete to-the-studs renovation recently completed. 

The love Leslie & Patrick have for the area and their historic motel is surpassed only by their commitment to making your stay relaxing. You'll sleep well when you put your head on a pillow at Sleep Woodstock. We promise!

We've also been awarded Tripadvisor Customer Choice Awards from 2015-2021, including a 4.5 out of 5 bubble rating, 4.9 out of 5-star rating on Google, and a 9.4 out of 10 rating with Hotels.com.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: We figure you come to Woodstock VT to explore, to eat, to shop, to fish, to ski, to hike, to antique--to escape and have fun! So when you're ready for a good night's sleep, don't max out your travel budget. Put your head on a pillow at Sleep Woodstock Motel. Our rooms are comfy, our location historic, and our budget-friendly prices leave money in your pocket so you can enjoy more while you're here.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Owner and Innkeeper at Lang House on Main Street since 2003.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: The Lang House on Main Street was built as a private residence in 1881 on land once owned by University of Vermont founder and legendary Vermont Green Mountain Boy Ira Allen. The original owner was Frank Dudley, who commissioned Burlington architect and builder, John McLaughlin, to construct the house.  The house at 360 Main Street remained a private residence until the mid-1970s when a local real estate firm, Lang Associates, purchased the property and gave the house its name. In 2000, the Lang House was converted to an 11-room Vermont B&B inn, preserving the house's historic nature while adding contemporary amenities. All through the Lang House, you will see all the architectural qualities you might expect in a 19th-century Victorian home: period furnishings, soaring ceilings, stained glass windows, stunning woodwork, and plaster detailing with a rosette pattern repeated throughout the house. Kim Borsavage has been the innkeeper and proprietress since December 2003.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: We are an 11-room Victorian Bed and Breakfast that specializes in providing the best quality accommodations and customer service we can by combining 19th-century charm with 21st-century service. We are a Select Registry member bed and breakfast in the heart of downtown Burlington, VT. We strive to create a warm and cozy atmosphere for our guests in an elegant and luxurious setting. Some of the amenities we provide to satisfy all of our guests' needs are private baths, plush bathrobes, comfortable beds, updated furniture, iPod docking stations, heat and A/C control, wine and beer license, and the service of our accommodating and knowledgeable staff. We serve gourmet breakfasts each morning with locally procured meats, cheeses, dairy, and produce. Options could include poached eggs over pan-roasted herbed potatoes topped with a roasted red pepper sauce, spiced pecan waffles with cinnamon-spiked Vermont maple syrup, or our House made granola served with local yogurt.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: Most recently the location of Ye Olde England Inne, our Stowe Vermont hotel begins a new life on October 1, 2015 as Stowe's newest boutique lodging choice. Completely transformed, Field Guide offers a fun luxe lodge design, a quick stroll to boutiques and dining, and a short drive to the slopes, as well as luxury linens, blackout curtains, and a variety of other amenities to appeal to the discerning traveler.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Unique among Stowe hotels, Field Guide Lodge is your starting point for discovery
Ski, bike, hike, shop or just enjoy the beautiful Green Mountain scenery; Field Guide Lodge is an unexpected and delightful starting point among Stowe hotels for exploring Stowe in any season. Centrally located in the heart of downtown Stowe and a short drive from Mount Mansfield, Field Guide Lodge's rooms and suites in the Lodge and Trail House offer year-round accommodations perfect for an intimate escape, a friends' weekend, or a family get-together.

Explore style and fun
Explore all that Stowe has to offer from our modern take on a classic Vermont ski house among Stowe hotels. Nostalgia-meets-modern design, a pool and hot tub, and countless unexpected touches make a stay at Field Guide Lodge a uniquely Vermont experience. Two separate buildings offer a variety of rooms for an intimate getaway or a larger group trip. Roomy Trail House suites are ideal for families or extended stays while intimate modern Lodge Rooms offer cozy comfort.

Mountain biking in Vermont is easily accessed on the trails leading from our Stowe hotel's back door. Shopping in downtown Stowe is just a short 10-minute walk away. Stowe Vermont ski slopes are a 15 minute drive (or free shuttle ride) up the hill. We offer storage for your active gear, and an iPad and printed field guide to help you choose the Stowe area activities and attractions that fit your lifestyle and budget...

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Since December 2014, we've been busy owning and operating Homestyle Hostel, a lively hostel, cocktail bar and restaurant combo run out of a charming Victorian home across the street in downtown Ludlow, Vermont. When the opportunity to buy the Motel across the street came along, we decided to embark on a renovation journey that led to the creation of Main + Mountain Bar and Motel.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: Main + Mountain Motel opened in January 2018!
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Meet our newly renovated boutique motel, functional yet fun, simple yet well-designed, with a sense of authenticity and adventure that reflects the spirit of the area. Here you'll find a lobby bar showcasing spirited mixology & handcrafted cocktails, craft beer and wine. Open to the public.

Tucked in the woods on 21 acres inside a historic 1792 house, The Inn at Weathersfield is a peaceful, private hideaway for couples with 12 unique guest rooms, all private baths, a full-service farm-to-table restaurant, an outdoor wedding Chapel in the Woods, outdoor event space, freshly cooked breakfast every morning and more.
Explore the grounds. Sit by the pond and read. Sip your morning coffee out in the garden or a glass of wine on the front porch. Hike the nearby trails then sit by the outdoor fire pit with a drink from the bar. Dine inside or out on the back deck. Explore Woodstock's charming downtown shops. Hike Ascutney Mountain or in the winter, ski Okemo or Killington.
We love weddings of all sizes. Whether it's just the two of you or you invite up to 120 guests to join the celebration, we make it the most memorable day of your lives.

The 506 Bistro and Bar has quickly become a local favorite and offers the best of Woodstock. Offering a simple, seasonal menu featuring Vermont highlights. Set in the open bar and lounge, the atmosphere is casual and warm. You are likely to be served a Yankee pot roast, a great organic burger from a nearby farm, or a fresh strawberry shortcake with Vermont berries. Local, simple, home cooked is what we are all about. The 506 Antique Bar is one of the highlights at the On The River Inn. Every vintage touch is a great conversation piece, showcasing a rustic elegance designed to celebrate Vermont. The perfect place to kick back at the end of the day and enjoy our selection of Vermont microbrews, cocktails and wines.

Blind Tiger is a love letter to Burlington, Vermont. A pied a terre inspired by the sustainable living, artistic pursuits, and all around good people of Vermont. Originally built in 1881 and set on a tree lined street and among other gorgeous historic homes, Blind Tiger is a grand brick mansion just a short stroll to Church Street, Lake Champlain waterfront and other lively neighborhoods in downtown Burlington. The residential neighborhood of Burlington Heights is one of the most desireable in the city and where you can have access to it all, including peace and quiet if you want it.  

Our guesthouse and gathering space is your key to uncovering what Burlington is really about. We are allergic to tourist traps and inauthenticity, we believe that the locals know best and are continually inspired by community and creation. We’ve taken the guesswork out of your trip to Vermont,  let your local hosts provide a distinctive insider's perspective on the city and surrounding areas, both well-traveled and delightfully off the beaten path.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Located between Davis and nationally acclaimed Lake Berryessa, just 25 miles from Sacramento International Airport, Winters, California is the eastern gateway to Napa wine country at the beginning of little known but beautifully manicured two-way Hwy 128.

Known for their restaurant scene and outdoor activities, Winters has experienced a spike in popularity with tourists in recent years for its small-town charm.

Our charming four-star boutique Hotel Winters is nestled in the heart of downtown, surrounded by celebrated restaurants, renowned wine-tasting rooms, and unique shops.

A USA Today poll reports Winters is leading the state as a small-town food destination, ranked fifth in the country, ahead of Yountville, Healdsburg and Half Moon Bay.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Twin Farms is an intimate, all-inclusive country hideaway set amidst 300 acres of meadows and woodlands in an unspoiled valley, 15 minutes north of Woodstock, VT. Hand painted murals, rich maple and pine woodwork, American folk art and museum-quality contemporary oils adorn the rustically elegant accommodations and lounges.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Leaving behind the Southern life I migrated from Louisiana to New England in mid-April 2012 to take over Follansbee Inn. The transition from Louisiana to New England and from lawyer to innkeeper has been exciting. The magnificent scenery of Kezar Lake and the surrounding mountains is my daily inspiration. 

My Louisiana life was influenced by both New Orleans cuisine and the Cajun cuisine of Southwest Louisiana. Both styles of cooking influence the breakfasts I serve at Follansbee Inn. Come to Follansbee Inn to enjoy Southern-spiced New England charm in one of the most beautiful spots in New Hampshire!
attributes.about_this_biz_history: Follansbee Inn was built as an inn giving us wide hallways and a well designed floor plan for an inn.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Historic 18 room inn on Kezar Lake. Every room has a private, en suite bathroom. Follansbee offers the ideal setting to enjoy nature, whether as an active participant using our complimentary kayaks, canoes, sailboat, rowboat, or bicycles, or swimming, fishing, hiking the many beautiful area trails, snowshoeing, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling (we are ON the trail), downhill skiing (check our ski and stay packages for nearby Mount Sunapee and Ragged Mountain), or as an observer spending days by the lake relaxing and recharging, then dining at one of the many area restaurants before a fireside night cap at the inn.

Every morning rise to a delicious and hearty breakfast, reflecting the Innkeeper's Louisiana heritage. Virtually everything is made from scratch, and entrees include the sweet (Praline Bacon, Stuffed French Toast, Angel Biscuits, Blueberry Scones, Cinnamon Rolls) to succulent masterpieces (Eggs Sardou, Homemade Sausage, Eggs Beatrice, Bacon Cheddar Roulades). . .

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Christa took over The Old Stagecoach Inn in 2022. She loves making people feel at home and helping them connect with unique, local experiences. Part adrenaline junkie, part bookworm, Christa has wide ranging interests that help her make recommendations to suit everyone's pleasure. She looks forward to welcoming you to Waterbury and helping you experience just what makes Vermont a favorite destination for so many travelers.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
The inn was built in 1826 by Waterbury's first lawyer, later Judge, Dan Carpenter, and his brother who previously had been active in construction of the Congregational Church just to the south. 

The inn, or tavern, served as a rest stop for people and horses and as a local meeting house.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Historic bed and breakfast with a pub, built in 1826 and conveniently located in the heart of Waterbury Village, Vermont's recreational crossroads. Walking distance from many local restaurants, shops, and the Amtrak station. If you're looking for more options, Stowe, Montpelier, the Mad River Valley and Burlington are all less than a 30-minute drive away. We're the perfect location for a hub-and-spoke trip exploring craft breweries, distilleries, endless outdoor recreation options, and more.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Both bring an entrepreneurial background.  Linda in interior design, cooking, and physical health; George in marketing, landscaping, creative pursuits, and guest engagement.  Both take strength from anticipating and providing for guest needs.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: Built as a luxurious bed and breakfast that would be perceived more as a boutique hotel because of the quality of its guest and public area appointments.  While the original owners were from Virginia, they loved the unspoiled beauty of Vermont and felt that Stowe Vermont's reputation as an upscale vacation destination would be prefect for this new breed of Bed and Breakfast.  We purchased the inn from these folks in October 2011.  Since we have continued to upgrade all of the guest and public room appointments and have established the Mission of Stone Hill Inn as "providing unexpected opportunities to celebrate life together."
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Our Stowe, VT bed and breakfast is a luxurious and romantic Vermont getaway. Enjoy beautifully decorated rooms, each offering a king bed, fireside Jacuzzi-for-two, garden views, flat-screen TV with DCD, iPod plug-ins, free WiFi and more! Situated just seven minutes from popular skiing at Stowe, our Northern Vermont inn is the perfect choice for couples who treasure time together in a romantic setting.  Forbes.com named us one of the Top 12 B&B's in North America and Select Registry awarded us "Innkeeper of the Year". We invite you to come experience luxury, romance and relaxation at our bed and breakfast in Stowe, Vermont.

about_this_biz_business_recommendation.description: Great place for casual dining.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Patty has been successful in Sales and Management and all facets of running a startup business, as owner of a Publishing company for 15 years, she was able to pursue a lifelong goal and obtained her Nursing Degree with the intent of becoming a traveler, and seeing the country. Patty enjoys people. 

Dan too has taken the long and winding road to this place in time. From 8th grade English teacher, to radio disc jockey, advertising agency owner, Cable TV Advertising Sales Manager, partner in Patty's publishing company, massage therapist, Cardio-Vascular Surgical Tech, and presently, Software Educator. 

The day-to-day operations of The Hummingbird Inn are Patty's responsibility, while Dan maintains his current position as Software Educator. Fortunately, he is able to work from "home", and will most always be available to assist with guest responsibilities.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
First built in 1780 and expanded in 1853 to its current size, an historic Shenandoah Valley bed and breakfast has long been noted for its hospitality. 

Architectural features include wraparound verandas on the first and second stories, original pine floors throughout the house, a rustic den with a working stone fireplace, a comfortable living room, a spacious dining room, and a solarium. A deck, next to the old barn, which was once the town livery stable, overlooks Mill Creek, a wide trout stream. The one acre grounds are beautifully landscaped. The house was upgraded and became an Inn in 1991.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Enjoy a romantic setting and warm country hospitality in our unique bed and breakfast.  We offer wi-fi throughout the Inn, internet radios in all rooms, 24 hr. coffee bar and beverage refrigerator, plush robes, and cozy fireplaces and sitting areas in every room.

Outside the Inn, stroll around an acre of landscaped grounds.  Sit on the deck and listen to the sounds of the Mill Creek, in the evening, light a fire in the chiminea and enjoy the crisp fall air. 

If you're looking for peace and quiet, cozy and comfortable surroundings that feel like home, we welcome you to our Inn.

name: Craddock Terry Hotel and Event Center

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Penny Loafer is the  "Official Greeter" of the Craddock Terry Hotel and Event Center, and is a Wirehaired Fox Terrier. As a member of the hotel team, she loves to welcome new guests, as well as any furry friends that come to stay with us at our pet friendly hotel.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: The Craddock Terry Shoe Company was founded in 1888 by John W. Craddock.  Craddock Terry Shoe Factory began a legacy in Lynchburg, VA, and grew into the 5th largest shoe company in the world. The original site of the main factory, the Southland Factory, sits below us in the empty lot adjacent to Waterstone Pizza on Jefferson Street.  When the Southland Factory was unable to keep up with orders, the main building of the Craddock Terry Hotel was built in 1905 as the Craddock Terry Southland Annex. This building produced over 2,500 pairs of womens shoes per day. The Craddock Terry Shoe Company produced every type of shoe, from baby shoes to combat boots, to the tune of nearly 100,000 pairs daily at the peak of their production capacity. The other half of our hotel, the King building is housed in the William King Jr. Tobacco Warehouse. The King Building, built in 1896, was used for storing dried and drying tobacco by the Imperial Tobacco Company.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: What was once a turn-of-the-century shoe factory has been transformed into a one-of-a-kind luxury hotel blending original brick warehouse architecture with chic modern style and historical artifacts from the heyday of the Craddock-Terry Shoe Corporation. From the moment you're greeted by Penny Loafer, the four-legged official welcoming committee, your stay will be marked by charming and whimsical details. The Craddock Terry Hotel features:

about_this_biz_business_recommendation.description: The Blackfriars Playhouse is a popular attraction for guests at Frederick House.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Joe was a former banker and Evy was an insurance auditor.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: Frederick House is a collection of six historic buildings in downtown Staunton, the oldest city in the Shenandoah Valley. Most of the buildings originally were family homes. Beginning in 1983 these homes were remodeled into hotel space and furnished as rooms with private baths for travelers. Additionally, a former commercial building now houses our entrance and breakfast room.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Beautiful bed and breakfast hotel in historic downtown Staunton, VA. Twenty Three beautifully appointed guest rooms and suites with delicious homemade breakfast each morning.

name: The Virginian Lynchburg, Curio Collection by Hilton

attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Welcome to The Virginian Lynchburg, Curio Collection by Hilton. A centerpiece of downtown Lynchburg since 1913, this magnificent hotel has been thoughtfully restored to its historic grandeur and refreshed with modern amenities. Walk to restaurants and boutiques, stroll along the James River, and dive into the arts and creative scene. Downtown is full of hidden gems, Point of Honor is a mile away, and the Snowflex Center is nearby for year-round skiing.

Settle into a spacious guest room with comforts like complimentary WiFi, an HDTV, mini-fridge, Keurig® coffeemaker and cozy bathrobe. Suites offer a living area with wet bar, sleeper sofa, and a private bedroom with second HDTV, and many have a dining area - perfect for executives and family stays.

Kick-start your day at the hotel coffee shop, and see Lynchburg from a new vantage at our rooftop restaurant and bar. Relaxing after a busy day? Call on room service to have meals delivered to your door. Our convenience shop and lobby gift shop ensure everyone's taken care of. Prepare for your day in the 24-hour business center, and work out in the complimentary 24-hour fitness center.

Our Lynchburg hotel offers over 8,000 sq. ft. of beautiful event space for meetings, conferences and receptions. Host your wedding in our 1900's-style ballroom showcasing the grandeur of the era with gorgeous ceilings, columns and moldings, and make your entrance down the spectacular original staircase...

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Welcome to Foxfield Inn where we love to pamper our guests with a blend of comfort and luxury.

Your innkeeper Brigitte spent most of her professional life as a Human Resources expert in the German financial industry. She also knows from experience that in today’s demanding work environment it is important to have places where one can go to unwind, enjoy good food, recharge the batteries and reconnect with the most important people in one’s life.

Let her treat you to a memorable and relaxing stay enhanced every day by breakfast delights and fine treats.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Foxfield Inn is located in one of Charlottesville's most picturesque country settings near Foxfield steeplechase track, yet only 15 minutes from downtown Charlottesville.

Our Bed & Breakfast offers 5 beautiful and uniquely decorated guest rooms in a relaxing and peaceful environment.

The Inn is smoke-free and pet-free environment in all guest areas. The entire Inn is on one floor.  All areas are air conditioned.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Foxfield Inn is a cozy Bed & Breakfast located in scenic Charlottesville, VA.  If you are looking for a place to relax and get away then we are it for you. We provide a rejuvenating, peaceful environment and are located 15 minutes from downtown Charlottesville, the University of Virginia and wineries and only 30 minutes from the Blue Ridge Mountains/Shenandoah National Park.  

Our five guestrooms offer a quiet oasis for you to relax and forget about your daily life.  If you are looking for a romantic getaway stay in one of our four deluxe rooms which have fireplaces as well as Jacuzzi bathtubs. The Dogwood Room, our fifth room, has a queen bed and a bathtub/shower combination.

Don't forget to bring you swim attire as you can also spend some time in our outdoor hot tub enjoying the night sky. Or you can gaze at stars while sitting by the firepit with a glass of wine.

So come join us at Foxfield Inn and let us pamper you for a day, a weekend or even longer. 
We look forward to welcoming you!

attributes.about_this_biz_history: The Blackburn Inn is one of the most historically significant remaining properties in all of Virginia. Envisioned by master builder and Thomas Jefferson protégé Thomas Blackburn, The Inn honors the original architecture while creating a destination ideal for discerning travelers.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: The Blackburn Inn & Conference Center is a tranquil historic hotel in Virginia less than a 5-minute walk from the excitement of downtown Staunton and the Shenandoah Valley. Savor relaxation and rejuvenation while easily exploring the local area, accessing nearby event hubs, shopping, dining, and more. You won't find a better B&B in Staunton, VA!

attributes.about_this_biz_history: Omni Hotels & Resorts creates authentic guest experiences at 60 distinct hotels across North America. From our resorts featuring over 20 world-class golf courses and award-winning spas to downtown properties perfect for leisure and business travelers, each Omni showcases the local flavor of the destination while featuring four-diamond, personalized service. The brand, founded in 1958, is frequently recognized by top travel magazines, consumer research organizations and trade publications.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Located on 45 acres in the Allegheny Mountains, the Omni Homestead Resort features 483 guest rooms and suites, two 18-hole golf courses, full-service spa, clay tennis courts, indoor pool, lazy river, two water slides, fitness center, multiple dining outlets and movie theater featuring nightly movies. The hotel is a short drive from Roanoke and Washington, D.C. and is surrounded by many outdoor activity options like skiing, mountain biking, hiking, kayaking and horseback riding. Roanoke Regional Airport is located 47 miles from the Omni Homestead Resort.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: John and Kate purchased the Inn at February of 2011.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: The inn was created in 1972, utilizing five original 19th century buildings. The old blacksmith shop house the Country Store and office. The hardware store provided space for seven guest units. The Steel House, a private home, four guest rooms. The home of the miller (Miller House) has another four guest rooms.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
The rooms and suites at The Inn at Gristmill Square are individually furnished in traditional décor with the feel of home. All have private baths and air conditioning. Many rooms have their own fireplace. Each room at our bed and breakfast inn is charming and unique.

Included in your room rate is a continental breakfast with fresh-baked pastries, juice and coffee delivered to your room upon request. The Waterwheel Restaurant serves dinner every night of the week and Sunday brunch in season (March-October).  Relax by our outdoor pool and enjoy three tennis courts. $10 for each additional person over 12 years. No pets, please. Check-in time, 3:00pm Check-out time, 11:00am.

Room amenities include:
Satellite TV * Small Refrigerator * Wi-Fi * Phone * Private Bath * Two Bathrobes * Hair Dryer * Iron & Ironing Board

about_this_biz_business_recommendation.description: Unique winery that makes its wine and meads from OTHER than grapes - just 3 minutes away
Great Food and beer just 8 minutes away
Great food and beer just 5 minutes away
Great Food and Beer just 2 minutes away
#1 Cider maker in the world!  Just 3 minutes away!

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Leslie has always had a love for hosting. It's this passion that helps her excel in her role. Nothing brings her more joy than the praise of her guests!
attributes.about_this_biz_history: The original log cabin was built in the then-called Wintergreen Valley on 1000 acres in the 1800's by Charles Everett who also owned and built the Belmont Estates in Charlottesville. This successful entrepreneur and physician to Thomas Jefferson was one of the founders of the UVA Medical School. He and friend Thomas Jefferson would escape to what was then called Upland Manor for weekends of relaxation and sport. Charles Everett was childless but very much devoted to his nephew, John  Everett, who he sent to medical school. John Coleman moved to the Philadelphia area and became a wealthy physician and slave holder. Although Charles Everett willed everything to him, he would receive only Upland Manor if he didn't free his slaves. John  found it impossible to release his slaves during Civil War times, and he therefore only received Upland Manor. He married Nelly Martin who became the first Postmistress of the town of Lodebar which is now Nellysford, named for Nelly Martin.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
The Mark Addy Inn invites all guests to experience the bliss of a quiet, mountanside retreat. Surrounded by scenic, winding roads, an expanse of vineyards and winerys, dotted with antique stores that burst with character. It's a place where time loses relevance, and the laid back feeling helps you catch up on the rest you've been missing out on. 

Our Inn has plenty of character on it's own. A restored record of a bygone era, the walls tell stories and the rooms have heard the wisdom of thousand voices. It is elegance and comfort at its finest, where an unmatched attention is detail is take to everything from the rooms to the exquisite dining. 

For an elegant meal or a relaxing stay, we'd love to have you at The Mark Addy Inn.

We operate a unique Lodging and Cabin experience in the Slatyfork/Snowshoe area of West Virginia. The facility offers guided Fly fishing trips on our area wild trout streams . Our 145 ac farm provides over 5 miles of marked hiking trails that border the Monongahelia National forest . Our location is close to Cass Scenic Railroad , Greenbank Science facility , Cranberry Glades Back country and Wilderness .

attributes.about_this_biz_history: The Joshua Wilton House was built in 1888 by Joshua Wilton for his family. It was one of the very first houses in the valley to have electricity. After the Wilton family moved on, it went through many different stages, including apartments, a boarding house and even the TKE fraternity house in the 70's. In 1986, the Moore family purchased the Joshua Wilton House and took two years to lovingly restore the home, opening on it's 100th birthday in 1988 as a bed & breakfast and fine dining restaurant.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Located in an elegantly restored Victorian mansion in historic downtown Harrisonburg, Joshua Wilton House offers fine dining within walking distance of James Madison University. Executive Chef Tom French uses high quality ingredients from many small local farms and producers to create a Shenandoah Valley sourced, seasonal menu of unique dishes. Full bar service includes signature cocktails, craft beer and an extensive Wine Spectator award-winning wine list. During the warmer months, seating is available on the outdoor brick patio. Arrive early and enjoy a cocktail in our lounge before dinner.

name: By the Side of the Road Getaway Lodging

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: We are a family run business operating since 1999.  We have a passion for old houses & restoration.  We've been blessed to share the space we've been given with many wonderful people since we opened our doors.    Harrisonburg is home to James Madison University and is a thriving city in heart of the Shenandoah Valley.  We invite you to come see what Harrisonburg offers!  We are located just 1.5 miles from downtown where there are delicious dining options and great shopping from antiques to shoes.  Come see us!  We can't wait to meet you!
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
If walls could talk, those at By the Side of the Road Bed & Breakfast
would surely hear some interesting tales of war and peace in the heart of Virginia's beautiful Shenandoah Valley.  Having served as the home of a prominent conscientious objector and early leader of the Mennonite Church, and later as a Civil War Hospital following General Philip Sheridan's devastating "burning of the Valley", this large post Federal period structure has provided shelter to many with opposing points of view.
By the Side of the Road, the City of Harrisonburg's first official bed and breakfast, offers a unique combination of the pleasures of a peaceful country retreat and the convenience of a location within minutes of the amenities and entertainment of our thriving city. Innkeepers Janice and Dennis Fitzgerald invite you to be their guest.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
A Former B&B - Now A Shenandoah Valley Vacation Rental
Our former award-winning bed and breakfast, established in 1999, has been transformed into Harrisonburg, Virginia's premier short-term rental property to serve your Getaway Lodging needs in a unique and beautiful nine-acre "Oasis in the City."

Five intimate cottages, one cozy apartment, and a circa 1789 Manor House located on nine manicured acres with large fishing pond and deck. Your rental will include all the amenities expected in a high-end getaway lodging accommodation - luxury bedding and linens, spa tubs or multi-faucet shower rooms, mini kitchens, beautiful décor, peace, and privacy. Our property is just minutes away from dozens of eateries offering gourmet menus for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and late-night food for sit-down or take-out. We are fully licensed, insured, and inspected to guarantee a professionally operated and maintained destination for your two-day or two-week vacation getaway.

Our new Tru by Hilton Staunton is ready to welcome you. Located next to shopping and dining, we are also close to the highway and just a quick drive from all the fun and culture in downtown Stauton, Virgina. Our rooms include free WiFi, a large TV with premium channels and fun, bright décor. With 30 different sweet and savory topping on our breakfast bar, you can try it all. Indulge or go healthy: bagels, eggs, oatmeal and more is free each morning. Stop by our Eat. & Sip. Market for gourmet snacks, single-serve beer and wine, open 24/7. Work in our spacious lobby's semi-private alcoves, or have fun with a table game. Relax on the outdoor patio, get in a workout in our fitness center or grab a free cup of coffee or tea.

Affordable travel now comes with unexpected things - like certainty.

about_this_biz_business_recommendation.description: A great spot to grab a sandwich for lunch while exploring Warm Springs.
View and shop beautiful local art! They also provide lunch on the weekends.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
John and Caryl Cowden were high school classmates in their hometown of Dayton, Ohio but never had a single date. After college, both moved back to Dayton where the romance began. 

John's father, although a bussinessman, was always a farmer at heart and in 1959 he bought Fort Lewis Plantation to run a cattle operation. 

In 1978, as newlyweds, John & Caryl moved to the farm in hopes to bring a new perspective to the struggling farm enterprise and start a family. After having three kids, they realized they loved the farming lifestyle but their needs were outgrowing the farm income so they decided that it was time to share the beauty of the farm in a bigger way and build a country inn. 

The lodge is their fourth child. They are 'hands-on' innkeeperes with a goal of providing a getaway to the great outdoors with comfortable accomodations and delicious food, all at a reasonable price.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
In 1750, Colonel Charles Lewis settled here and built a small stockade to protect the southern pass of Shenandoah Mountain from Indian raids. Lewis went on to die a hero's death fighting the Shawnee, allies of the British, in the 1774 Battle of Point Pleasant, now widely regarded as the first conflict of the American Revolution. His vast 3,200 acre mountain farm has remained relatively unchanged over its 200 year history.

The Cowden family purchased Fort Lewis in 1959 and opened Fort Lewis Lodge in 1988. Today you will find a rare combination of unpretentious elegance, superb food and unique lodging choices where every room has a view. Evenings are highlighted by farm fresh American style cuisine served nightly in the restored 1850's Lewis Gristmill. We strive to be stewards of the land while continuing to raise cattle, grow crops and provide for wildlife.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
A celebrated historic hotel, listed on the National Register of Historic Places, The Willard
first opened its doors in 1818 as a two-story row-house. At the time, the city of
Washington, DC was in its early infancy having been established as the nation's capital by
the Constitution of the United States twenty-eight years prior. As Washington, DC expanded, so too did The Willard. What began as a two-story hotel with only a few rooms, quickly expanded to a 150-room hotel in 1847. Recognizing The Willard's strategic location and close proximity to The White House, the U.S. Capitol, and the Treasury, Hotel Manager Henry Willard strove to establish his property as the leading
luxury hotel in Washington, DC. Over the years, The Willard's reputation for being one of the finest hotels in the city grew. In 1862, famed writer Nathaniel Hawthorne observed that the "Willard Hotel more justly could be called the center of Washington than either the Capitol or the White House or the State Department

The Hay-Adams
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
The Hay-Adams is one of the city's most revered landmarks. Named for the distinguished residents who once made a home on the same site, John Hay and Henry Adams, our historic hotel is now a popular destination among visitors and Washingtonians who come here to experience luxury in the nation's capital. 

In 1884, the architect Henry Hobson Richardson designed elaborate, Romanesque homes at the corner of 16th and H Streets for Hay and Adams. For years, the homes served as Washington's leading salons. Famous guests such as Theodore Roosevelt, Mark Twain, and Henry James stopped in from near and far.

In 1927, Washington, D.C., developer Harry Wardman bought and razed both homes. He replaced them with the Hay-Adams House, an Italian Renaissance-style, apartment-hotel, designed by architect Mirhan Mesrobian. Wood paneling from the Hay residence was repurposed in the public space now known as the Hay-Adams Room. Many historic details have been carefully preserved to this day.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Steeped in rich history and surrounded by the most iconic institutions of our nation, The Hay-Adams is the discreet luxury hotel in Washington, D.C. for discerning guests. Enveloped by views of the White House, St. John's Church, and the scenic Lafayette Park, the 5-star accommodations at The Hay-Adams are the embodiment of refined residence. Marked by Washington, DC's most accommodating amenities and dedicated services, The Hay-Adams is the boutique hotel of choice for the modern luxury traveler.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
The Mansion and O Museum is a series of five interconnected town houses that includes over 100 rooms and over 70 secret doors.

The building was designed in 1892 by Edward Clark, architect for the US Capitol two centuries ago.  

In the 1930's the home was converted into three separate rooming houses for FBI Director J. Edgar Hoover's G-men. 

In the 1960's, the student leaders of the protest movement lived there -- Norman Mailer wrote about them - and the house - in his book "Armies of the Night".

On February 14, 1980 the property was purchased by H.H. Leonards, who restored its original character by reconnecting the row houses. 

A resident of The Mansion for over a decade - Mrs. Rosa Parks entertained friends, dignitaries and guests while she stayed there and hosted a Sunday gospel brunch each month. 

Highlights include hand painted ceilings, original Tiffany stained glass windows, a two-story Log Cabin, Mrs. Rosa Parks' room and more.

With our themed rooms, secret doors, art, music, and architecture The Mansion on O & O Museum is one of the most unique and creative environments in the world. 

Our mission is to empower people to do what they love -- dare to be different -- and have fun. We inspire creativity, diversity, and imagination through the fusion of the arts, science, and sports.

As a non-profit museum, events venue, and boutique hotel we provide a nurturing environment that inspires guests to open their hearts and minds. Guests are encouraged to explore themselves, engage with others, and experience how we can each be unique and similar at the same time when they visit.

Founded in 1980, the Museum is home to over 100 rooms, 70 secret doors, legendary themed rooms and unique exhibits including the Pop Culture Room, John Lennon Room, The Log Cabin, Safari Room and Mrs. Rosa Parks Room (she lived there for 10 years)

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: Keanen is the General Manager of the Brewhouse Inn & Suites. His passion for hospitality is an asset, not only to our business but to our valued guests.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Situated in Milwaukee's Brewery District, The Brewhouse Inn & Suites is a historic hotel nestled in the former Pabst Blue Ribbon Brewery. 
The roots of the building trace back to 1848 when Jacob Best founded Empire Brewing Company. The reins passed to Phillip Best in 1859, and under the presidency of Frederick Pabst from 1872, the Best Brewing Company claimed the title of the nation's largest brewery by 1874. Captain Pabst, in 1889, renamed it the Pabst Brewing Company. 
Despite challenges, including a sales dip in 1978 and layoffs in 1996, the historic building gained recognition on the National Register of Historic Places in 2001. In 2011, Gorman & Company undertook its transformation into The Brewhouse Inn & Suites, preserving its heritage. 
Opened in 2013, the hotel harmoniously blends historical charm with modern comforts, serving as a tribute to Milwaukee's brewing legacy.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Milwaukee Downtown

attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: The DoubleTree by Hilton is perfectly located in the heart of Downtown Milwaukee and is an ideal destination for those visiting Brew City. The Baird Convention Center is adjacent to the hotel while the Milwaukee Public Museum and Fiserv Forum are steps away. Within a few blocks, you will find the Marquette University campus, the Summerfest grounds, and the entertainment district. Local businesses include Harley-Davidson, Molson Coors, Manpower, Rockwell Automation, Johnson Controls, Northwestern Mutual, and Milwaukee Tool. Enjoy valet parking, a warm DoubleTree cookie upon check-in, Hilton Honors benefits, free WiFi, and a microwave and refrigerator in each of the contemporary guest rooms. An onsite restaurant, The Avenue Bar and Grill, offers traditional Wisconsin fare for breakfast, lunch, and dinner each day as well as full-service, seasonal sundeck patio. The award-winning team looks forward to welcoming you to the legendary city of Milwaukee.

The Hilton Milwaukee hotel is a classic downtown Milwaukee Hotel recognized as the city's finest hotel with a tradition of excellence going back more than 80 years. The gracious style of the hotel is reflected in our impeccable service and attention to every detail.

Combining its 1920s grandeur and elegance with today's modern conveniences, the Hilton Milwaukee hotel features beautifully appointed guest rooms with plush furnishing and the latest in-room amenities, the distinguished Milwaukee ChopHouse featuring savory steaks, fresh seafood and an extensive wine list, and the renowned Miller Time Pub and Grill, perfect for unwinding with friends and co-workers.

In addition, the Hilton Milwaukee hotel has a well-earned reputation for hosting weddings, meetings, conventions and banquets. More than 30,000 square feet of beautifully appointed meeting and event space, convenient indoor skywalk connects to the Baird Center convention facility, lavish crystal ballroom perfect for hosting elegant affairs, exceptional private board meeting rooms complete with state-of-the-art technologies, and exquisite catering and banquet services for your special occasion.

The Hilton Milwaukee hotel is also steps from many local attractions including the Milwaukee lakefront and Henry Maier Festival Grounds, Fiserv Forum and the Deer District, the downtown entertainment district, and the Milwaukee Public Museum...

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: With a background in special education, a master's degree in Vocational Rehabilitation, and an array of hospitality experience including managing a local nonprofit's hospitality training program, our General Manager, Meghan, leads guest experience, oversees hotel and tavern operations, supports staff development, and strives to keep Dubbel Dutch involved as a strong community partner. Meghan values preserving Milwaukee's rich history and is highly committed to being of service to others and leaving no detail behind to ensure each guest's individual needs are not only met but exceeded during each and every stay.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: What is now Dubbel Dutch, was first built in 1898 as a side-by-side mansion for 2 families (who were siblings). The Koeffler and Baumgarten families lived in the building until approximately 1918 when the Annenberg family moved in. They moved out and the building became a rooming house in about 1924 until the 1960s, when Taxman Investments bought it. They converted the building into commercial and office space in the mid 1970s. A permit was filed in 1985 to tear the house down and the city put a stop to that by landmarking the building in 1986. In 2019 the building was purchased by Juli Kaufman of Fix Development, Patrick R. Jones of Ramsey Jones Architects, and Andy Braatz of Braatz Building. Construction began that winter and Dubbel Dutch officially opened and hosted its first guests in July of 2020.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Built as a side-by-side house in 1898, Dubbel Dutch emits character in every inch of floor tile and crown molding. Each room, with a story as interesting as its layout, melds contemporary amenities with 19th century architectural details. With an interior that transcends any timeframe, every room is inviting yet stately. Dubbel Dutch offers online, self check-in, and key code entry for the independent traveler yet staff are on call 24/7 for any assistance!

attributes.about_this_biz_bio: The Ambassador Hotel is managed by a team of hospitality professionals.  We worked together to provide a complete luxury experience for each and every guest.
attributes.about_this_biz_history: The beautifully restored Ambassador Hotel preserves the original Art Deco style which has made it a Milwaukee landmark since the 1920s, and we've added all of the luxuries you have come to expect from a modern hotel. Marble floors, elegant bronze elevator doors, and Art Deco detailing are the backdrop for the sumptuous bedding, modern amenities, and our top-rated onsite restaurant and lounge where you can enjoy memorable cuisine in a relaxed, yet sophisticated atmosphere.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
A shining example of true Art Deco style, the Ambassador Hotel provides an urban oasis near the heart of downtown Milwaukee.

Discover a remarkable blend of modern amenities and 1920's Art Deco design. From the original marble floors and bronze elevator doors to the ornate plasterwork, every detail of the Ambassador Hotel is a testament to the bold beauty of Art Deco. Our spacious guest rooms share the same level of sophisticated décor. Guests enjoy luxurious bedding, HD smart televisions and complimentary Internet access.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: The hotel is located in a historic neighborhood which was once the center of a thriving retail area. The building was designed by Eschweiler & Eschweiler to complement and stand out in the neighborhood while offering stylish and trendy options for the time period. Locally, the Art Deco movement was at its peak and the architecture of the building reflects that via the high ceilings and curvature found throughout the building. It was built as an office building in 1937 and was the first to have central air conditioning throughout.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Our centrally located boutique hotel is in the heart of downtown Milwaukee and boasts an intimate, Art Deco style. Hotel Metro, Autograph Collection offers spacious guest rooms and meeting capabilities for all types of functions up to 125 people. And take advantage of being within walking distance of multiple city attractions including the Public Market, Fiserv Forum, Lake Michigan and the Milwaukee Art Museum. Onsite dining is available at Oggie's Kitchen & Bar and multiple downtown food and beverage venues are an easy stroll from the hotel. Take in compelling city views from the hotel's rooftop bar. Enjoy comfort and convenience during your time in Milwaukee with special features offered in select rooms including fireplaces, soaking tubs and the ability to fulfill requests through Alexa.

name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Milwaukee Downtown

attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Homewood Suites by Hilton Milwaukee Downtown boasts convenient location in the Historic 3rd Ward near the lakefront, shopping, restaurants and nightlife. The hotel occupies a completely renovated historic building in downtown Milwaukee close to area attractions and convention space at the Wisconsin Center and the BMO Harris Bradley Center. Johnson Controls, Rockwell Automation and many Fortune 500 Companies are located within close proximity to our Milwaukee hotel. 
Each spacious suite offers complimentary internet access, spacious work area, a flat-screen TV and a sofa sleeper. The in-room fully equipped kitchen includes a full-sized refrigerator, microwave, two burner stove and dishwasher to make you feel at home. 
Our one-bedroom suites provide extra space and a separate living area. Some suites are located on the higher floors with great city and river views.
Start your morning right with a daily hot full breakfast included with your stay. Enjoy complimentary evening social with dinner and drinks* offered Monday through Thursday. Make use of our indoor splashpad and whirlpool after you work out in the fitness center. Stop by the on-site convenience shop for a quick snack or a meal to prepare in your room. Our Milwaukee, WI hotel offers a business center and a 585 sq. ft. conference room with audio/visual equipment for up to 45 guests.
*State and local laws apply. Must be of legal drinking age.

Housed in the historic Marshall Fields building, the Residence Inn Milwaukee Downtown blends old-world splendor with modern amenities. Our downtown Milwaukee hotel is an all-suites hotel offering an incredible location. We're connected to the 3rd Street Market Hall and within walking distance to Baird Center, the theatre district and Fiserv Forum. Whether relocating to Milwaukee or looking for a Milwaukee extended-stay hotel, you'll feel right at home. Choose from studio, one- or two-bedroom suites with full kitchens, luxurious bedding, flat-screen TV, wireless Internet, and separate living areas. At any time, visit our market, business center, and fitness center. Enjoy a complimentary breakfast buffet. Surrounded by many businesses and cultural attractions, the Residence Inn offers first-class service and friendly staff.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: If you're looking to discover Milwaukee, you have come to the right place.  Adjacent to the bustling Deer District and 11 miles from General Mitchell International Airport, this hotel boasts an ideal location to experience Brew City. Enjoy being steps away from the Fiserv Forum, home of the Milwaukee Bucks, as well as the city's hub for world class entertainment. Explore our lively neighborhood's dining and nightlife options and delight in easy accessibility to attractions including the Milwaukee Art Museum, Wisconsin Center and Historic Third Ward. Retreat to contemporary rooms with ultra-cozy beds, walk-in showers and LCD TVs. Meet and mingle with friends or colleagues at W XYZ bar. Enjoy breakfast or grab a bite from our 24/7 re, Fuel pantry.  Maintain your workouts at our 24-hour fitness center or take dip in our indoor pool. Stay connected with high-speed Wi-Fi and reserve our stylish meeting space if you'll be hosting a meeting. Embrace an action-packed Milwaukee stay at Aloft Mi

attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: Green Mountain Motel sits at the feet of the Green Mountains and offers cozy and comfortable accommodations. We welcome bikers, bicyclists, hunters, and corporate clients. We offer short stay and extended stay options based upon your needs. Please give us a call to book your reservation today!
